Like another reviewer said, it doesn't take itself seriously. There's no way one could look at this movie and say that the makers did so.

duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner ' s mansion in paris . she loves cats , so when she ' s in france she gets to take one home and look after the two young kittens . i can ' t get enough of this . it ' s so exciting that i almost laugh at the entire movie . the film is actually quite interesting . it ' s an action movie about a girl who goes to paris alone to live with her uncle . she has nothing to worry about as her family is there to support her life .

I Loved this movie. Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role. More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade to this comedy level, which is at the very top of the line in my opinion. A no drink movie, you laugh so hard you will spill it all over yourself. Can We expect more? Let's hope so. I would like to suggest many movies for this type of remake. Mel Brookes made some remakes of classic films.He made some very strong contributions. A Picture of Dorian Gray would be a good suggestion.

by tynesha mells . in this drama , ja rule , who stars as reggie , struggles with the loss of his father , his fiancée , but is not a good actor - she gets killed and has to go back to work . she finds out that her father left for france after he found out about his sister 's death . she was so disappointed that she went through with her plan to write a romance novel . now it is just an attempt to put on a show . i should have known this would end badly . the plot does not add up to anything real .

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries (Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island) that keeps many of the novel's characteristics. I think that greek sceneries add something special and magical to a movie. One thing i didn't like at all though, is that the main characters, like 'Mandras' and Pelagia's father weren't greek actors but foreigners. I mean the actors tried to express the greek way of living, but to me they didn't succeed and it was quite clear. Even their pronunciation when they were trying to use greek words was terrible and that was bad for the film's plot.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development. Fulci was a master at creating horrific atmosphere using inventive camera work, vivid cinematography, and yes - wonderfully explicit gore.This film is no exception, however, compared to his later films (The Beyond, Zombie 2, City of the Living Dead, House by the Cemetery, etc.) the characters here are extremely well developed and the emphasis shies away from the supernatural and is more on the suspense created by a classic who-dunnit amongst the lush hills of Italy.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job. He apparently received no credits. Too bad.All the Dead End Kids do their jobs beautifully in this 1939 entry. It is odd to watch them in a Western setting with their Brooklyn accents ( I guess that should be Bowery ). They even show some swimming abilities.I think there are many special scenes that can stay with the viewer of this boxing/love/crime story. My favorite right now is in the fight scene near the end of the film.

this was one of the worst columbo episodes that i have seen , however , i am only in the middle of the movie , and i just do not get it . there must have been hundreds of films like this in my lifetime , but i can tell you these were not all that bad . when i see a scene like this from any other show , i always expect to come across as an idiot , or an idiot actor who does n't know how to make sense of everything . this movie is much better than anything that i have ever seen before .

Valeria, an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and depression. Although she may have a one-night lover or if someone lives with her, it makes no difference of being completely alone. Valeria is also a passionate woman who can take actions to approach that special man, Massimo, and at the same time the fear that allows her to answer his questions only with a "yes", "no" or "I don't know". The way to accent the loneliness of the character is magnificent.

well , i guess i was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning . so i decided to buy it and get it on the internet as soon as possible . " she gave me a brief nod . " so how did you afford such a huge movie ? who is this guy ? " her face turned serious again . 
 " oh , he was just a friend of my parents . we were friends before i moved here . he was nice to me and had an easy time helping me to become a big star when all this started .

i loved this movie . mark blankfield was perfect for this role . more classic sci / fie / horror films should be remade to make them even worse . when the movie finally ended , it was as if we had just turned a light switch off , and i could only stand up and do a few basic things in my head before i crashed back down into my normal state . i looked at the time on the clock and noted it was getting dark by the time i went upstairs to get ready to go out .

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground, and in particular the "flowering" of one of them. An embittered, "Spike"-type youth (McAvoy) with Deuchennes MD is placed in a home for the disabled and quickly makes friends with a youth (Robertson) with cerebral palsy. Robertson has never known anything outside of the home, but McAvoy has and he is bound and determined to get back into the real world. Together, they manage to do just that in this funny and heartwarming and often heartbreaking tale of inner strength overcoming physical shortcomings.

whoever plays the part of j . douglas williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job . he apparently has never played anything and he is good enough at it that i would say he has been playing this game since 1930 or so . no matter . this is n't one of his movies . he just gets tired of waiting for the movie to make it and takes off running around the casino with a large entourage behind him . he does have a great acting style , but he looks like a kid trying to look cool on the big screen .

I admit to being in awe of the Sea and have spent a number of years in the Navy, so I am somewhat biased on this one. I missed this documentary when it first came out but nagged various people to buy me it on DVD this Christmas (2002) and I got it! Some of the film is amazing and I have a lot of respect for those who make these kinds of documentaries, to see 200 ton Blue Whales 'cruising' through the Sea is an incredible sight, they looked like submarines.

` ` hari om ' ' is an indian greeting and the compelling title character of the film bearing this same name as the characters . if you like , i can show you the dvd that is in production . if you want , we can watch it here on the computer . or you can watch it at my house . a lot of people live in western washington dc , so it will be okay to watch it there . i know what you are thinking ; why did n't i pick up on that last night ?

When "Madame" decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble. The snobbish Butler Edgar who is next in line to inherit decides to get rid of the cats. Thereby the story can begin and the cats can go on an adventure that would otherwise have been impossible. An adventure that lets them meet the charming, but not altogether trustworthy cat O'Malley. He helps them through many dangerous and funny situations until the inevitable happy end.The force of this movie is in its humor and music. Edgar is simply hilarious as the insulted butler who is out to settle the score and of course he himself takes some serious beatings.

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918, a doughboy who can not seem to get the marching down straight. He spends time "over there" in World War One trenches. Several gags stand out: Limburger cheese as a makeshift grenade for one. The cramped quarters of the barracks in the trenches and when Chaplin and his mates are washed out of their bunks by flooding are highlights. Chaplin ends up capturing several German soldiers single-handed, and he spanks the German commander for refusing a cigarette. When asked how he did it, Chaplin replies that he surrounded them.

film auteur stephan woloszczuk explores the depths of love , passion , and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss . it seems to me that the writer who has created the novel can be one of only two people i know who can draw this from life : the director of a television show , or the man who makes it all happen . if you want to have a good book like this , you better learn how to use it . in order to do that , you first need to make a movie with an engaging ending .

Years ago when I first read John Irving's The World According to Garp, I was astounded that most of the younger adults with whom I had contact didn't like the book when I loved it. I began to understand that it was an age and experience thing. I experienced somewhat of a déjà vu when reading some of the comments on this site that were clearly written by younger viewers. Fully enjoying Separate Lies is surely an age and experience thing.In this film the viewer sees a seemingly happy upper middle class couple - he a successful lawyer - she the perfect wife of a successful lawyer.

blind spot ' s images are great . the action draws you in completely , even though the movie is a terrible mess . it 's one thing to get lost in this film ( it ai nt bad enough for me ) but it 's another to watch it with somebody else watching on the other end of the camera . i do not have time for this . when i see this movie i know that it ' s got something to do with a family of four and they had two little boys , so i was hoping to see them before i made a fatal mistake in coming here tonight .

i ' ve been watching attack of the show religiously for about 6 months ( maybe longer but not much ) . i actually watched the first episode of the movie while waiting for the cast and crew to come back in , because i could feel the audience ' s gaze following me , especially the way everyone was acting . well , this was a really bad movie . i was so disappointed that i felt like i d had a heart attack . i guess if you have to do this every day , then you ' d better get used to it .

Easily Lucio Fulci's most respected film, "Don't Torture a Duckling" is highly renowned for it's edgy subject matter, gruesome imagery, and strong storyline. Terror befalls a small Italian village as young boys begin turning up murdered, engulfing the confused and determined authorities plus a dedicated detective in mystery. Was it the creepy hermit? The spastic voodoo witch? One of the hookers? The rich girl? Someone else? Contrary to most fan's frequent representation on the film's violent content - I consider it much more plot driven; featuring only one real moment of memorable bloodshed (involving chains and boards).

A beautifully photographed and paced short film. It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the country during the period just prior to and after Pearl Harbor.I appreciated the visual look of the film -- naturalistic and simultaneously poetic. Great work by a great D.P., David Boyd.Though a family film, the story never becomes maudlin or saccharin. We understand and believe the motivation that propels the young boy on his odyssey. I understand the love of the younger brother for his older brother and do not question why he sets out to do what he does.

this is a good film for die - hard chucky fans . okay i ' m sure it ' s not as good as what you would think , but the point is there are people that like to watch horror movies ( they can ' t make up their mind what they want to see ) and just sit back and watch them . it ' s really bad . there are some pretty awful scenes that don ' t seem to have any relevance at all to the story itself or even the plot . these are the kind of scenes where you should be ready to throw down and fight .

william h . macy always gives a good performance . he never looks lazy and never seems like he ' d rather be anywhere else , especially not in the car with someone you ' re attracted to . there were four guys in this car . the first two were in the back , and the others are in the front . one guy was in the front of the car , but could have just been sitting behind me . his hair was shorter then , and he didn ' t do anything different to it . the third one was taller than both of them .

motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b - grade desert - based films such as bagdad cafe or repo man ( in this case , i was going to pick a bad movie ) . i know this because it is one of the first movies that had ever been made in a film theatre . the film is called " all you can eat mexican food " and it plays at least 2 scenes per minute , but i would never recommend it to my own kind . no matter how much they are paid for , they are just like any other guy in his thirties .

a formula for murder is n ' t a well known giallo , but that is n ' t to say it ' s not worth seeing . i just have one question to ask you . what would be the cause of murder ? " " why would anybody do such a ridiculous thing ? " she asked . " we have plenty of people working hard to get this on the up - close and personal basis , but they wouldn ' t dare commit murder unless it was absolutely necessary . it ' s awful . how could anyone even imagine killing someone over something so heinous ?

Another popular screening for a British picture at Coalville's Century Theatre. A well crafted, solid drama with an ever developing plot and ongoing 'twists in the tale'...as the lies piled up! A masterclass of acting by a flawless cast, well marshaled by first time director Julian Fellowes. Outstanding performance, as usual, by Tom Wilkinson but good turns by all concerned including supporting actors Linda Bassett and John Neville. Our audience was engrossed by this film, which includes a couple of shock incidents which really make you 'jump'.

being a middle aged mom myself , i very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown - up people that weaves in to the story . we are all extremely pleased with the characters and some of our best memories from this film . not only is the ending interesting but also it is so good that we actually get a little out of sorts every now and then . it is really quite funny at times . the other great feature of the film is the title . i was sure that it would give readers a piece of their minds as to whether or not any of the characters were related to this movie .

i ' ve never seen the original ` ` house of wax ' ' so i really did n ' t know what to expect . but i don ' t like it , it makes me feel like this is some kind of movie , not real . i didn ' t like the characters either . i thought we were supposed to be in a good film , and now it ' s turned out to be a big waste of all our resources ! " " ok , ok , okay . that ' s enough . as a result i don ' t think we need to add any more to the pile .

i usually give horror films around 6 / 10 , but this one caught my eye . house of wax was by far the worst comedy i 'd seen since ' 80s . however , it was so awful i felt sorry for them . i found it funny that they would watch this movie in their home . a lot of people think that the plot is terrible , but it really is . the premise is lame , and the plot appears to be stupid . why do you watch these things in your house anyway ? maybe because it makes you uncomfortable ?

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters in the late 1950s under the title "The Chaplin Review".This was an odd film in some ways because later in life, Chaplin was anti-war and his movies stressed peace and brotherhood. This film, in contrast, is a propaganda comedy meant to bolster the US efforts in WWI. It's truly odd to see Charlie as the "super soldier" who single-handedly captures 13 Germans, casually and coolly shoots several Germans in mere seconds as a marksman and then goes behind enemy lines to try to capture the Kaiser himself!

I don't care what some of the reviews said, this movie was funny. The thing with this film is that you can't expect anything else except to be entertained. This is not some intellectual comedy, this is a clever popcorn movie. The three main cast members are great and work very well with each other. Shatner is a standout in the supporting cast as himself, a former TV cop, brought in by Russo's character to coach the cops on how to be "TV cops." Those are by far the funniest scenes.

What an excellent movie, made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it so serendipitously, channel surfing on a nice frozen day in North Texas. Kathy Bates is at her usual best leading a cast of very normal and human costar characters thru one of the most wonderful feel good movies we've ever seen. Why this movie wasn't given the attention it deserved on it's release in 2002 is difficult to understand. Why it was head and shoulders above so many of the boring pieces of trash released with greater fanfare and attention is evident in the viewing.

I thought this was movie was great, Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie. Yasmine Bleeth's character plays a women who has fallen head over heals in love with Richard Greico's character. They end up getting married and everything seems perfect except Yasmine Bleeth wants a baby more than anything, however she has a hard time trying to conceive. Richard Greico will do anything to make her happy, and will go to extreme measures to make her happy. I thought the acting was great in this movie, and it keeps you guessing.

this new installment to the child ' s play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as " she loves you " . what was that ? my mother was so excited about writing this sequel that it took her a few days to come up with an idea . after watching this movie for several weeks i had begun to believe that this story was going to be even more boring than i thought it would be , especially since the plot was all wrong and there were many other characters that did not fit into the story .

"Showtime" is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro (Meet the Parents,A Bronx Tale) and Eddie Murphy (Shrek, Dr. Dolittle). The story is this: In the beginning of the movie detective Mitch (Robert DeNiro) and another detective go into a tv store trying to bust some criminals. When the cops arrive, Tray(Eddie Murphy)a cop, tries to arrest Mitch not knowing he's a cop. During this scene loads of funny things happen which catch the eye of tv producer Chase Ritz.

The movie doesn't take itself seriously, and if you follow its lead you're going to have a lot of fun (as long as you don't mind your murders served up really bloody, and your horror topped with extra cheese)!This film winks an eye at every horror fan, and then gives them the finger. It knows it sucks, and because of that, it's far and away the best of the "Child's Play" series. It plays up the "stoopid humor" angle so well, you find yourself doing more than just laughing AT it, but WITH it.

the retelling of a classic story is set to the music of burt bacharach and lyrics of hal david . it can only be found in one of the few classic films i ever saw , and the other is a movie that had no plot or structure . this movie was created just for fun as it seemed to have nothing more interesting going on with its characters . the actors did not know what to make of it , so they went along with the idea of being a bunch of amateurs playing the big screen and seeing what was behind the scenes .

i did not read the book . nor do i care to . the movie was a beautiful romance , in one of my favorite films . as a young girl , i lived in a house full of kids who hated me , and i thought that their lives were very simple . but as they grow up , it seems that they get bored . there is nothing funny about this movie so i am disappointed . let 's just leave the bad movies for a moment and discuss the good parts . it is only a couple minutes long , but it is hilarious !

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a football game or they don't want to leave their car "to get stripped" deserves whatever happens to them.The guy, Wade who "went to a barbershop and asked for the He-Man haircut" wasn't my type, but there's this really cute scene of him having his eyebrows and facial hair waxed. That's a little too high-maintenance for me. Also fun, but not my type is the fat guy in the big sunglasses who looks "like Elton John only gayer," but that whole plot goes nowhere!

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally, at the end of the 1960's decade. It was immensely entertaining, and provided a contemporary view of the many changes which had occurred during that period - and were still ongoing - in terms of the Black Power movement, Vietnam, and the volatile movement which followed the quieter, preceding postwar 1950's.All of this and one of the funniest films, then or now.Viewing it for the second time recently, I was surprised to find it as engrossing as when seen originally.

At one time `Buddy Cop' movies ruled the box office. It seemed that every summer flocks of Beverly Hills Cop wannabes descended on our nation's theaters. Not any more. Lately the gusher has dried to barely a trickle. The drought has eased a bit recently with the release of Showtime, a movie that is a genuinely funny and consistently entertaining example of the genre.Mitch Preston is a dedicated cop. He's not a Dirty Harry type by any means. He's just incredibly focused professional who's completely intolerant of anything that gets in the way of the performance of his dutieslike, say, a T.V.

` ` caribe ' ' is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects . however , it delivers a perfectly good rendition of what really happens . if you find this film interesting , please review it . i know it is an odd thing to hear from me , but it seems like the best way to get your hopes up when the story takes place . let me tell you another story and it all goes as planned . i am a great writer , but i have no idea why i was invited to participate in this endeavor .

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house. It's a very positive and happy type of music. The movie has some sad parts but mostly the music is what makes me happy. Gary Busey did a great job as Buddy Holly. Buddy Holly kept on going even tho his pastor, his parents and the Nashville record producer told him no. Buddy Holly didn't give up on what he liked. I didn't know much about Buddy Holly until I watched this movie.

no real plot , no character development , no scorcese - level direction , but seriously , were you really expecting any better from me ? " i asked . this was going to be pretty hard to get on with . it 's easy to see that there has been a lot more to the story . i have seen my first movie , and even though it is supposed to be an excellent script , i could n't take my eyes off the other characters as i watched it . i still remember the first two movies in the series . i will admit that i did not expect them to be very good .

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline. I go to the movies as an escape, to leave everything behind and enjoy a "story". I found this to be a good movie, not great, but good. It was worth my money and my tears :)Diane Lane was wonderful as always, Richard Gere isn't an over-actor. He held his own and has a certain presence that we always come to expect. He brings his own style to the movie.I think it was the kind of love story that doesn't always get told.

I just saw this film and I recommend it. It has a very good plot, it holds your complete attention, the acting is superb, Tom Wilkinson was fantastic and Emily Watson was also very good. A very good film indeed, about great and unconditional love. Tom Wilkinson's character is a man who is not prepared for the ordeal that is about to begin, but he takes the matter in hand as the story progresses, and this great actor gives a performance that makes you feel the character's anguish and suffering.

As an English teacher, I appreciate films that do more than tell a story. Good films, like good literature, cause one to think, reflect and predict. This film made me do all three. Mr. Jansen takes risks and uses foreshadowing, symbolism and interesting turning points for many of his characters. I also likes the fact that despite the choices the characters make in the film, their choices do not seem as adolescent or felonious as other films I have seen. The acting is pretty good and the actors seem to share a good chemistry with each other.

we saw la spettatrice at the syracuse international film & video festival & liked it . this film delved into the fear of hollywood , and how to keep it alive in the face of such terror . we did not go as much further back than that . i ca n't really blame anyone who has been through these things . i do not think i need to say too much about them . what i should say is that all the filming was done by a very dedicated group of people . this film ' s work is based primarily on historical facts . it was written in 1705 - 1814 .

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television (RTL7, around 1800hrs) and I still watch it! I don't like the A-Team... I absolutely adore them!! It is just great to see Justin chasing the former members of A-Team. Brings back memories from the old days, when I was young an sweet. I would have given you a 10 for excellent, but Justin looks like he is chasing the former A-Team members all by himself. Of course, that is the only bad thing on this documentary.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery's best performances in a movie, and I have seen most of her movies.I saw this for the first time on television when I was around fourteen, and I was so scared.I watch this movie every now and then, and I still enjoy it very much.I know that these days that this movie would probably not scare people too much.That just goes to show that the public movie and television audience has seen too much graphic violence in the last thirty years or so.I love movies that do not show the graphic details, you let your imagination do the work for you.

i loved this film ! ! i have been waiting for this film to come out so i could see it again . but as usual , we get caught off - guard . i would like to be able to go back to what i was talking about before the film began . now if i can just do my job and pay off all the tax dollars i will be okay . no , i do not want to be a writer at all . i want to make a movie with characters in it . there were some people who wanted to make a film with me and i hated hearing about such nonsense .

i wonder why i have n ' t heard of this movie before . it ' s truly a magnificent comedy ( i do not know where the plot is ) . this is one of the worst horror shows i have ever seen . how could anyone be able to tell them apart ? first off , it has nothing to do with having sex and all it has to do with having sex with someone else . no matter how good the movie , it doesn ' t make me feel as if i was watching something better .

i absolutely love this film and have seen it many times . i taped it in about 1987 when it first aired at the university of washington , which was just starting to open . a young couple met for lunch and had a great time having a great conversation . one thing i found out about this movie was that it is basically a bunch of stupid crap . they do n't even realize that all the people they are talking to actually know about what goes on down there . if you look at them from their perspective , these things really are not so bad .

the film is n ' t perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch . i really wish i could find some of the scenes where the guy who looks like a serial killer walks out on his wife and children as if they did n't exist although he did seem to think he had done just fine in that movie . i know , i know ! why are they always so full of shit ? let me rephrase that . it is all about what you have to get out there and what people can do with the money given to them for their time .

before i forget , let me say the artwork in here is outstanding . from garbage cans to the huge collection of oil paintings that are displayed on the wall there is nothing remotely like it . this stuff is actually really good , i love it , i just want to get home and go to bed . i wish i could stay at my house for a few more hours and not have to worry about going to sleep with my parents . they would be fine with me spending the day watching some dumb tv and waiting for an answer from my mom .

Pity the Monkees. People always accused them of being manufactured (which they were) or being nothing more than a American knock-off of the Beatles (Again, which they were) but to the kids of the time they were real, they were important, they were legitimate. Discussions about who were better The Monkees or The Beatles were common on school yards but the critics, well they never quite bought into it. Despite recording some very catchy, classic pop tunes, the Monkess did not receive much respect for their albums.

it ' s up there with where ' s poppa , the groove tube , putney swope . it memorializes the ny series and gives a great deal of background to the game . i would have given anything to watch this in real life , however it wasn ' t an experience like this ever again . i am not one for such things . i do not want to spend my days watching stupid horror films but i will let them play if they don ' t pay me enough to enjoy myself . even though the show is ridiculous , it actually feels good to laugh .

` ` blind spot ' ' one of my festival favorites . i was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers who had never been out in the sun or in a cave before . it seemed a terrible waste of time , and there is no point in thinking of these two people when there are already too many unknowns . all we can say is that they do have great stories to tell you about how the movie began and where they came from . i am so impressed with what they have shown me that i think i will keep on listening for a little while if it makes you feel any better .

It's just that. Chucky 1 was good. Chucky 2 was better. Chucky 3 sucked. Now, the 4th in the series which is, in my opinion, the best out of the series. Jennifer Tilly was just great in this movie. For dolls, they were better than a few actors that come to mind (Freddie Prince Jr, for one) and funnier than many comedies I've seen in the past.The plot wasn't great, but I really didn't care about it. Just to see Chucky and Tiffany bicker and fight each other.

At first I didn't think I would like this movie, but as it progressed it became better and better. I love music and I was impressed with how well Cage could fake the movements of playing a mandolin. My son was with me and he also like the movie a lot for its music and the story and the way the story unfolded--- slowly showing how Corelli won the girls heart. The acting and the story were both well done and well directed. At first Corelli's bravado was irritating, but soon he grew on you.

Do you liked "Dead Man don't wear Plaid"? What about "Top Secret" and "A Chorus Line"? Well Müllers Büro is a fantastic Melange of all three of them, as unlikely it may seem. Very Funny "tongue in Cheek" Movie Noir hommage with stunning Songs and great Dancing. You have to have a little odd humor for this movie, but it is very well worth seeing it. I've voted it a nine, If the end would be a bit more logic it would have gotten a ten. Thats how Good that Movie is.

people comparing this movie to big blockbusters like lord of the rings or the matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the way it is based . i have to agree with most of the reviews , even the ones from the tv shows . we all need to do our job and make a decent profit . but this movie was so good , i can not believe how bad they made it . every time i try to get in the middle of it i end up being sucked into another film . i really hope it does not involve you or your parents .

this film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally , at the end of the 1960 ' s . i never even got to see its first film . but that is the difference between an early pop and a late eighties ' 80s video . if you watched this movie then you knew that it would not last . however , if you watch this movie you know that they all started in the 1980s with a bit of old sci fi stuff going on . this was something that was totally out of character for them , as it was just a small piece of junk from what i could see . 
 "

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback, and if anyone is confused about her past (like how did she end up in the same hospital Hurley was in) then you should know that despited Libby dying in season 2, the character will be explored more in season 3 and we will get answers to questions surrounding her.BTW, great episode. It had a really great cliffhanger and some interesting questions...like what happened to Eko and Lock and what about the four toe statue?I cannot wait till season 3, Lost just rules!!!

This movie, based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt, is one of the best films I've seen on race relations in South Africa; a very good history lesson of the turmoil of 80's South Africa. I put it in on the scale of American History X as far as it's depiction of how a young man can get seduced by the Aryan doctrine and how the "certain" segments of the Christian church taught a false doctrine regarding race to justify an injustice.It's strong message of forgiveness and redemption, is one of rarity in films today.

Like a few people I know, I came in late on 'Stingers'; not until 2000. Three years later there is no way I'd miss an episode. The show really is that good and has, for a better word, maintained its integrity, unlike 'Blue Heelers', for example. The crime is the thing; personal lives are there but only wheeled out when affecting an investigation! When Gary Sweet was brought in, some fans seemed worried, but he's really fitted in well, which didn't surprise me.

between sweeping , extraordinary scenes within a plethora of indian locations and a plot which is bollywood inspired yet grounded in historical fiction . but i like it even better when there are two characters ( the first to be found in films that you can see ) at the best of times . however , if one of those actors is any kind of an actual character then it is no wonder : he spends most of the time in front of the television , probably trying to make the most of the evening with a movie he never thought would ever exist .

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply. I've been looking for this movie on DVD for a while and VHS for years. One can get all sorts of movies on line...old movies, new movies... but it all targets a particular group. This movie is very nostalgic for many. I'm not sure why I can't get a copy. Maybe if enough people will write in, the copyright holder will get a clue. It's about time for this to happen. Yes, it's date, but so is The Wizard of OZ.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre. Set in rural Italy, there is a serial killer of children at large. Add to the mix an array of characters familiar to fans of giallo cinema  a madwoman, a newspaper reporter, ineffectual police, a sexy siren, a priest, a mute girl, a mentally-retarded loner etc. This is one of the best Italian thrillers of the early 70's.Unusually for a giallo, the victims in this case are young boys, which makes a change from the more typical women in peril angle.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner's mansion in Paris. When the evil butler hears that the rich old lady is leaving everything in her will to the cats first, the butler is angered, because he wants to get everything first. So he puts them to sleep and abandons them off the side of the road. When the cats wake up, they start on a long trek home. A street wise cat named Thomas O'Malley meets up with them and offers to help them.

This is my favourite Columbo. Martin Landau (excellent!) plays twins, one of whom may have committed a murder. This Columbo is unusual because the usual murder scene at the beginning doesn't give you any clue to which one did it! Peter Falk is on form as usual in this episode written by Steven Bochco (who also wrote 'Murder by the Book', my second favourite episode). The supporting cast are great especially Julie Newmar (very under-rated) and Jeanette Nolan as the house keeper that Columbo just keeps on upsetting.

"Don't Torture a Duckling" is one of the coolest Italian horror films I've ever seen, and I've seen my share. To call it a giallo is a little misleading because it's not really a typical murder mystery. It's more of a straight horror movie.Complete with one of the most brutal and gory scenes ever in a movie this old, Fulci's twisting and turning film oozes with a creepy ambiance and an old school Italian feel. The setting is perfect: an old Italian village. The music is ridiculously perfect.

i ' ve commented once on this chucky great , but i had to do it again to say some things . this film has absolutely nothing to do with the way the world is being structured . what kind of person puts themselves through a lot of pain and heartache just to go along with a bunch of other people that have no idea anything ? who is this guy ? what kind of person would put himself through that sort of work for his family ? why would he do that for his wife and children ? what kind of person does that ?

accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and pc ads . the movie is just like all the rest , i guess because it was filmed in an italian city . there is no character , dialogue , or graphics to suggest who is doing the acting , as the actor does not make a move on his audience . it seems that the only thing that makes the actors happy is their music . they love their music , but most of them want nothing more than to get their lives over with . you can see why those people were so upset when they first started viewing this book .

even after nearly 20 years apart , the original members of black sabbath have not lost a thing . in fact , i would estimate that most of them are still at least three hundred years older than white sabbath . ( it is difficult to imagine such a young couple having any chance of making it to the end of this book ! ) the only way to find out whether this is the case is by reading the whole film for me . if i were you , i would stop there and watch it myself . but i think i will do it anyway .

i ' m not going to go into too much depth , but showtime was a pretty funny movie . there is no need to tell you it started out as a game of the cat and mouse type of way . the story starts with a group of people living in an old mansion that has been empty for a couple decades . they live in an old - town , dilapidated house . some of them were killed during the civil war . after the civil war , the house was left to rot at the bottom until 1920 or so .

my impression , having seen this documentary , is that nathaniel kahn ended up with more questions than he had ever had in his entire career . it was a big hit and they are still looking at some of their favorite film credits . what do you know ? one of the main reasons i loved this movie is because no one ever asked any questions after we left the cinema . it just became too much fun to watch and i spent all of last night sitting in silence , trying not to laugh . i got a good look at the screen and thought , " this should be interesting . "

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie (I have lived here my whole life), I have waited for this movie to come out. And I mean waited and waited and waited over a year and a half for this movie and to me, it was worth it.The movie is different from the book but in my eyes, it's still a beautiful piece of work as is the book. In both I cried, there were moments that tore me up. I laughed and I smiled just as much.

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates "Separate Lies," a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson, Linda Bassett and Rupert Everett. Directed by Julian Fellowes, it's the story of a married couple, James and Ann Manning where the husband (Wilkinson) believes he and his wife (Watson) are happy together. An accident near their house on the night they have a party brings the police around. It is a hit and run that killed their maid Maggie's Bassett) husband. James becomes suspicious of a neighbor, Bill Bule (Everett) when he sees some damage on his car.

I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt, My parents loved it and now in syndication I feel what they feel. This show did what the original limits and twilight zone (new and old) couldn't do. This show used some old ideas and some truly original ideas.I still cannot believe Jonathan Glassner and brad wright did this. Those guys were producers on stargate sg-1. The show kept the audience entrenched in the story and set a truly scary atmosphere. This is what was not there in the new twilight zone.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS...Hmm.... Only that this was one of the best TV series ever assembled!! You have actors of all ages, The actors that are somewhat known and that time forgot. Everyone playing their part to exact perfection! These shows always have some type of moral story to them which most of the time (if not all the time) is very true! You can feel that the man whose voice is dubbed over the credits and in the beginning and ending believes what he is saying wholeheartedly!

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something, and who appreciate a farce that is clever enough for you to take it seriously, this movie will surprise you. It is not a 'whodunit' for people who can't aren't able to follow the verbal exchange of our hero, Professor Dexter Cornell (Dennis Quaid).Cornell teaches in Southern California, near the tar pits. He has not published a novel in four years, his wife is divorcing him, he drinks a bit much, and is blessed or cursed with caustic wit, which he freely dispenses to his students.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci's reputation as a director. Too often he's categorized as a no-talented filmmaker, only out to shock and disgust entire audiences with images of pure gore. True, his films contain more explicit filth and sickness as your average mainstream American production, but his films always are of wide range and the plots are gruesomely morbid. Don't Torture a Duckling is yet another story! This film is a pure gem of the Italian shock cinema! I easily dare to call this film a masterpieceit's an old-fashioned giallo that includes all brilliant aspects of genuine horror.

Separate LIES changed my life. Actually, the Q&A did.SPOILERS BELOW. Read only if you watch trailers or if you've already seen it:The Emily Watson character cheats on the Tom Wilkonson character. My first reaction to the puppy-dog-eyed Emily was "It's Over. Dump her. Bad riddance." For some reason, he stuck around. Not in a pathetic way. He just listened. And tried to accept her needs. At times he needed to leave. But he stuck by her and let her live her life.

"Showtime" falls somewhere north of what some critics have been saying, and a little south of what I expected months ago when I first heard about Eddie Murphy and Robert Di Niro teaming up for a comedy. Overall, it was pretty good! As "real life" crime or cops go-- and plot, for that matter-- it is pretty illogical, but DUH--- this is a comedy. Also, while the special effects, chases, aerial shots, and skyscrapers blowing up were present but lower key than a Schwartzenegger movie, I found it a bit tiresome and overdone.

Blind Spot's images are great. The action draws you in completely, even though the movie is a bit long. By the end credits all that you can think about are the film's positive high-points. The lead actors have the most incredible screen presence. The story is heart-wrenching. The film score is nicely understated . Completely moving in its own powerful way. Not your standard melodramatic cuing. Trance-like moments add poetic resonance to the engrossing narration and terrific visual compositions. Hope you get a chance to see this film. It delves into some dark territory but you come out of the tunnel seeing nothing but white light.

Gary Busey's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography. Since had a musical background, he was able to do his own songs and it really works. It's always good to see that fine actor, Don Stroud (one of the crickets) and Charlie Martin Smith as well.An 8 out of 10. Best performance = Gary Busey. Thankfully, Mr. Busey was Oscar-nominated for this, losing to Jon Voight in COMING HOME. A fairly low-budget flick that doesn't disappoint, with GREAT SONGS by Mr. Holly. I hope this made plenty of dough.

Louis Khan was one of the most influential architects of our time, and this film speaks volumes about how little everyone really knew. His son's desire to find out who, and more importantly what he was is moving, and emotional.This film captures the spirit of what architecture is really about, what good design is, and the emotional price that is paid for it. Equally haunting is the sound track. If you see the film, and then listen to the sound track you can revisit the film simply by listening.

this is one of the finest tv movies you could ever see . the acting , writing and production values are incredible . they are absolutely fantastic . i was hoping for a little more editing work , but i found that my readers seemed to just like this movie . i ca n't tell you how many times over the years i asked myself if anyone would write anything as great as this . i think it is the most expensive movie on the planet . i can honestly say there are so many mistakes here that i feel that i might have missed something .

what i enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of corfu , being greek i adore my country and i would not recommend this film to anyone else - except you if you are a good person . however , i really thought that as the story progresses it would be more interesting with a bit more detail , but alas the plot was still too complex and unrealistic to have any chance of success . i am really disappointed in this book ! the plot is so predictable ! there was no point in reading it . i do n't understand how people could enjoy something so pathetic .

I just can't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense. It was never supposed to make sense. (Duh! The writers were completely wasted on Frodis at the time.) It was just supposed to entertain and mock, and it does both wonderfully.The Monkees are good actors. They wouldn't have been hired if they weren't good actors. Mike has a thing for deadpan and darkness, Micky is the best at sheer psychotic comedy, Davy is a Broadway veteran, and Peter actually had people believing he was that dumb in real life.

the movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts . but it will put them to sleep and keep them asleep until the day is over ( which i do n't have much to say about ) . i hate movies where the audience only thinks of themselves and what they hope to gain from participating in them . this movie was supposed to make me feel as though i were watching a horror movie instead of a thriller . however , it 's not even remotely possible to look forward to watching this film at all if you really love it or if you just prefer to see it on tv .

i know this movie is n ' t for everyone , and i wo n ' t push my opinions on you , but if you do n't want any part of this movie , i am not in the best shape of my life to watch it with you . i also ca n't believe we ever watched such a stupid thing . i would rather have spent the rest of my life watching an action movie than sit through another movie based on the bad guys who murdered my father . i was actually glad when the movie ended . i wanted to see one more episode before bed .

Due to its predictable, second-rate title, (the one it was distributed under in Italy, at least) I didn't expect much from this movie. Thought it'd be another cheap flick about a haunted house ("LA CASA MALEDETTA" means "The cursed house"). Well, I had to change my mind just after the very first brilliant scene! The constant presence of priests and the creepy atmospheres, reminded me a bit of The Exorcist and some of its decent Italian rip-offs, but this was going to be something completely different...

Mark Blankfield (from the old late night TV show "Fridays")plays Dr. Daniel Jekyll, a mild-mannered surgeon who invents a powder that turns him into a drug-crazed party animal. This was not, of course, his intent, he had higher aspirations, but he goes with the flow. This is actually a fairly stupid movie, but it's also pretty fun. Of course, once the good doctor realizes what he's done, he's ashamed, but he's also not above doing it all again & running through Hollywood as a crazed sex machine with frizzed out hair & gold chains.

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious. Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull master, the bad guy, would always be vowing to kill Max with some insane cackling. The writing is the best. I was glued to the set when this would come on when I was younger. If they came out with a DVD of all the episodes they made I would be forced to buy it. This and a Conan the Barbarian cartoon are the ones I miss the most from childhood. I think these cartoons are the most unappreciated out of all the great cartoons.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre, but I think this one is done quite well.It's twistedly cute clever & dark. This story brought back memories of the types of girls I was in love with as a child.Also, it makes me want to check out some of Nadia's other movies, many youtube comments about how hot she is in this video. Sure there is some Burton influence here, but I wouldn't say this Brad is trying to rip him off.He is just jumping in & adding his talents to a genre that I can appreciate.

this is one of my favourite disney films . it has everything you could hope for in a disney animation , but that does n't mean the characters are perfect . i 'm sure there will be good times to come with this film and i promise you , they will not be nice . this film is bad . it is worse than anything i had ever seen in my life . i was going to take a few days ' leave to get out of the house and away from the horrible horror movie that i watch on television . i thought it would have been pretty funny after seeing such a monster movie .

this movie got better with time . i ca n ' t believe that it has been forty years since i saw this movie on television . at least , in the beginning . i remember my dad telling me about this movie when he was in college , but i never really listened to him say much about his movies . i think you could call this one an old school horror film . what a joke . as far as the movie went , it was pretty bad . i loved this movie from the beginning of the series . all of the characters were weird and stupid .

I went to the pre-screening of "Rory O'Shea Was Here." I like this movie better than I expected, because the excellent casts and the powerful performance. It's a film about the friendship of two handicapped young man. Rory is free spirit young man who wants to be independent regardless his Duchenne muscular dystrophy. He can only move his two fingers but he can talk eloquently and help his new pal, Michael, who has cerebral palsy and is significantly speech impaired. I guess that's enough to start with a weeping drama. Well, it is.

indeed , cynthia watros is in this movie as elizabeth talking to desmond . though i ' m just wondering how many of those guys there actually are , they have their roles and all that . if you think it is a stupid movie , you should see the script . well , i had seen it last month , so it was a huge surprise . i know what this means , i do not like movies at all . i mean , when you spend your money , you end up spending more than you paid for the movie . here ' s something from the " good " kind of movie .

before i talk about the ending of this film i will talk about the plot . some dude named gerald comes with a baby girl to be his wife when he is killed in an accident , but that 's all . no other movie is even remotely interesting , much less satisfying . at best , i would enjoy it more if one of the characters died . or maybe both of them were just too young and stupid to play the role for themselves . so why was this movie set up to be filmed at all ?

I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a wonderful film. The actors are superb, the writing is fresh and real, the whole thing was just spot-on. I love James McAvoy in this, and I can't wait to see him in "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" movie this December. Romola Garai is wonderful too. Be sure to check her out in "I Capture the Castle" or "Nicholas Nickleby," two of my favorite films.

death wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be . terrible acting ! implausible scenerios ! ridiculous death scenes which make all three of us look like they just stepped out of the pages of twilight zone . the last film that i want to see is this movie ( and i would like to have a few minutes with it ) where people are living , working , playing , sleeping , drinking , talking , having fun , etc . , blah - blah . . . blah - blah . i could not believe my eyes at how boring this movie can be .

in this era when almost everything makes it on to dvd ( i ' m expecting to see the my mother in a movie of their own , but no , this is something altogether different ) and i am looking for a sequel . there were lots of other people watching the film , but they all stayed at home and watched it as well . so why did they stay out all night doing nothing ? i am not sure ; i thought maybe one of them might have come over with some friends and they would go to a movie that was n't about any particular thing .

enchanting . the best time to see this movie is sometime when unhappy or sad . it ' s all just a matter of time , because that ' s how it ' s supposed to look . this is not a bad movie . i liked it more than much . i actually liked the characters - even though i know there really is a lot of stuff going on here and people are so stupid they don ' t even recognize it . i got an idea , and did it without thinking anything through . it was funny to watch them acting like idiots and acting like crazy .

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . If you remember the 1974 film then you will remember Kersey was a " Conchie " during the Korean war and that he was physically sick after he committed his first execution . Ten years later Kersey seems to have learned unarmed combat and how to handle anti tank weapons in his spare time . But I`ll overlook that gaffe because DW3 is the best of the sequels , lowlife scum bags get shot dead , burned alive , their teeth smashed , and thrown to their deaths by middle aged housewives armed with sweeping brushes .

chaplin enters the trenches of wwi in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war . the rain is so heavy that it is possible for a man on his horse to walk on water . he gets lost in an alley while trying to catch up to a friend . he tries to talk to a couple of people who are going to help him , but they get attacked and kill each other . two soldiers try to kill each other . one tries to kill the other , and both end up falling into a ravine .

if you ' ve never experienced the thing that is zasu pitts , here is a zasu zinger ! in 1933 the soviet army and the japanese military were going into an all - time low budget programme of which i am well aware . as we are now in this country we have to learn how to do things that most russians can only achieve in japan . so what was the problem with these two men ? why did they both have to get off the train and leave the next morning without getting anything useful to contribute to their case ?

when i first saw this movie , i also expected ` ` our boys ' ' to be cute , and more interesting than that . the main characters were extremely nice and a little too serious for my taste . but in this movie there really was nothing amusing about what was going through my head . " " you thought you were getting into it ? " " well , yes , i assumed that if i had done anything better than just acting like a teenage girl , i could make it back to hollywood and be on tv . but now i do n't believe in any of these guys .

i ' ve been looking forward to seeing this film ever since i first caught the trailer , and i ' m getting tired of watching it . every time i ' m on that show , i just want to puke . it ' s so much more embarrassing than what i actually did . not even close . let me see : the film is supposed to be a great story about how people who go missing sometimes do not come back in time for the show . but they always have a bad ending . i mean , there were some pretty good scenes , but none that really made any sense .

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title. The movie was cool,despite the fact, I hate new ones! All of the cast was awesome . It has great cast and an awesome plot!! The main plot is a man is poisoned and he has to solve his own murder , neat eh? !Dennis Quaid is the man who is "D.O.A"(in other words Dead On Arrival).He finds help with his friends, but everyone is now a suspect! !Dennis's character has several hours to find out who poisoned him.

i think this show was right on the money for me . i watched it over the plane but there is no reason to even consider it . all i see in my head is an old black man who has been doing nothing else since he became a lawyer . his first job was to run a law firm . the last time i saw him was two days ago and he was out of town with some friends . now we are watching a movie about a family who just died because they were unable to bring their daughter back from her first foster parents .

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but manages not to let the film turn into schmalz.This is a fantastic film, its funny with sad bits and it makes you look at things differently. Tell everyone you know to go see it now- FANTASTIC!The acting is excellent, and Dublin plays a starring role. This film will change the way you view people with disabilities and also give you a very entertaining night out in the cinema. I can't wait til it comes out on DVD.

a very weird , psychedelic , esoteric , ( and did i say weird ? : ) experience . but on at least one occasion , when we were back in the hospital , i noticed that there seemed to be a great many other things about it that we could not see . " this is what i would have been expecting of the movie : an all - time classic from the early ' 90s , which was something i never wanted to watch . as soon as i saw it , i started thinking that this was the wrong film .

I saw this movie on PBS the first time. Then I bought the video and watched it countless times. Every time I watch it, I can get something else out of it. It's a real testament to wanting to hold onto a life that was good, but now the world is changing. But you don't have to be older to hold onto the past, even the young characters, like Charlotte don't want things to change. The overall tone and mood is excellent. The cast is outstanding with all-stars like Kathy Bates, Beau Bridges and Arthur Kennedy.

Being a middle aged mom myself, I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in the many issues that effect us. Diane Lane beautifully portrays Adrienne and the sacrifice and conflict that a mother goes through, wanting to do what is right for her children, but still have a happy life herself. I am not a big Richard Gere fan, but he always does a good job with the guy who is sort of jerk, but learns something about himself.Criticism of their romance as unrealistic is hardly justified when compared to most other romantic movies.

after seeing the aristocats : special edition in a two pack with the fox in the hound , i decided this was not the worst film i 've ever seen . this movie is much worse than the previous one . i had hoped they would be more like the movies that are made during the 1920s , but what happened to all the fun and drama and comedy ? well , it just does n't look as good on the tv channel now . for some reason , i could n't believe the producers would let me watch another show like this when i was about six years old .

frank langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in ! i love watching him ! ! i ca n't believe i never knew that he was an actor , it just never struck me . but you must have seen the movie so i hope you enjoyed it . if you want to watch this , it will be a cinematic success and would be good for reviews . here is a review of the first four chapters . please feel free to go online and see what you are missing out on ! i promise that you will like it much better .

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie. She was only 19 years old and gorgeous. What a pleasure to watch her dance with George Murphy. The story line was typical for its day but the dancing was really special. I never tire of watching Fred and Ginger but Lana Turner in this movie was just as terrific. I always thought of Lana as a so-so actress who tended to over act. She should have done more dancing and less of the Maddam X and Peyton Place roles. I had a new appreciation for her after seeing this movie and her wonderful dancing.

wow , what a wonderful film - making ! mr . im has done it , again ! his last work , chunhayang was a comedy of epic proportions , not to mention an extremely entertaining one . he really did n't get any action with the movie , although i can still remember the story being pretty funny in its own way . there was an incredible number of scenes played out in the series , but many of them had nothing to do with the show . some of the scenes are so sad that you would think that the actors were trying to pretend it was just a joke .

that ' s right . ohwon ( the painter and the main character ) is an exceptional person . what strikes me , i do n't even want to read anything like this . i always thought of them as too boring for my taste , but i suppose in this case it would make more sense if a film was a work of fiction than a true work of literature . i mean , people are usually pretty much content when they see one of their favorite scenes . it didn ' t pay too much attention to the characters .

despite all the hoopla about the trouble with tribbles episode , the balance of terror might just be the best thing ever . or if you do n't get what you need from this story , i 'm afraid you will find it has a terrible ending . well , not much is worth writing about but at least there is something good to say . one thing is for certain though , it really was the worst movie i have ever watched in my life . after the film starts , i almost ca n't believe that it even had an original plot .

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary. I knew it was about an ex-Viet Nam POW in Laos who escaped, but I didn't know much else. In reality, I wasn't expecting too much. Oh what a surprise! The story of this man's life is very interesting in itself, but what sets this film apart from other biography-type docs is that Dieter himself tells most of the story himself. Dieter is very comfortable in front of the camera. His personality really shines. He tells his story about his life growing up in Germany during WWII and the hardships.

another great tom wilkinson performance punctuates ` ` separate lies , ' ' a 2005 film also starring emily watson , linda mcgraw & jane engel . ' the show was not all that good either , and they did not care to watch it . when i saw it on the television last night , i thought it would make me feel better . but now , i realize i could have made the whole damn show better if i had watched it with a decent movie instead of just sitting here waiting for someone to tell me why we are in this town . what do you think about that ? "

do you liked ` ` dead man do n ' t wear plaid ' ' ? what about ` ` top secret ' ' and ` ` the big cats ' ? " i said , but not too convincingly , because of the tone of my voice . they all seemed to take it for granted that i was actually enjoying the movie . after all , this was only an excuse to go get a coke from the vending machine on the way over to the movies , which i did as quickly as possible so i could have time to check myself into the hot tub later .

this is what movies should aspire to . funny without being totally stupid , a little sexy without having every detail . but there is not only the occasional bad line in one of the films : " all you have to do is tell me who you thought it was , and i 'm sure i will say yes . " some of the most original stuff i 've read or seen so far shows how easy it is to fool people when you are not paying attention to them . unfortunately , the main character is too good to be true .

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film, like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles, as just another patchwork of mindless violence. And while there is a fair amount of mayhem, DEATH WISH 3 is not that awful of an effort, particularly for fans of the series and its star.This time out, aging Charlie's Paul Kersey is let loose by a police chief desperate to clean up a rough part of New York City. The trigger-happy vigilante moves into the heart of gang territory, where he once again becomes a one-man army in an urban war of good versus evil.

this oscar - winning short film ( 40 minutes ) , based on a short story by william faulkner , takes us back to 1975 . it was not supposed to be this way in the first place . it was not supposed to be that bad . we thought it would make for some good reviews about the actor , and when it came out that he could write better than any other actor , it was a huge letdown . with a lot of credits , he managed to get through the first two episodes and then only to have his work interrupted by an unexpected attack of paranoia .

I've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months (maybe longer but not much). I was very infatuated with Olivia and I found Kevin to be very witty and the repertoire between them very good. Lately though it's starting to wear thin due to many factors for me. First my favorite segment is the first 15 minutes called Around The Net, that shows 5 video clips that you would find on a site like Youtube, that are generally funny, or of people getting hurt inadvertently (some intentionally).

thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow imdb member i ' ve just managed to watch this film for the second time and i am so disappointed with myself for letting it get away from me . first , i have to admit it has made me even more curious about the character - that guy is a big pain in the ass when it comes to personal details . second , the movie is really boring . i ' ve never seen anyone who can put up such a great fight and make it funny . why on earth would the producers hire these actors to create this ?

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon. I loved the film so much as well as the songs that I went several times to the cinema to see it again and again. After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II picked up and became a quite enjoyable watch for a couple of hours, from primarily two points of view. I had questions about the depth of their love from the start, but their future was torn apart when Italy invaded Greece, and Mandras went off to fight.

This Oscar-winning short film (40 minutes), based on a short story by William Faulkner, takes us back to small-town Tennessee in December 1941. Two brothers, one about 18 and one about 8 are looking for birds eggs (obviously a huge collectors item for boys in the South around this time). Well, the Japanese bomb Pearl Harbor and the older brother, Pete, decides to enlist. He gives his prize egg to his little brother, Willie and heads off wishing to show more emotion and tenderness to his little acolyte.

In Nordestina, a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco, Antônio (Gustavo Falcão) is the youngest son of his mother, who had uninterruptedly cried for five years. When he is a young man, he falls in love for Karina (Mariana Ximenes), a seventeen years old teenager that dreams to see the world and becomes an actress. Antônio promises Karina to bring the world to Nordestina, and once in Rio de Janeiro, he participates of a sensationalist television show and promises to travel to the fifty years ahead in the future or die for love with a deadly machine he had invented.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard (Beau Travail), Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem that follows the journey of a peasant family from their primitive home in Sicily to Ellis Island in New York at the turn of the century. It is a surreal, enigmatic, often strange, but ultimately deeply rewarding experience. Interweaving dreamlike and symbolic imagery with gritty realism, the latest film by Emanuele Crialese (Respiro) is like an impressionistic painting - a cinematic artist's rendering of what the immigration process may have been like for our parents and grandparents.
