Apparently he was also in the movie..Monsoon Wedding. He was the total star of the show. Benoit's character cracked me up...was very funny. And the girl (forget the name) was great too. They were all great!

I think this show was right on the money for me. I watched it over the plane but there were parts in the movie that made me control myself from tearing all over the place. The chemistry between Richard gere and Diane lane was very believable (fantastic acting on both parts)! I loved how Diane lane's daughter acted in the show too. She displayed maturity and how she transformed throughout the show was easy to believe as what a teenager could possibly be like in real life. I loved this show from start to end. Definitely recommended for the romantic people out there!

i tend to get furious when hearing about lucio fulci ' s reputation as a director . too often he ' s only seen the movies in which he is cast as the " star " of the show . and even though the directors have made me feel good about the movie , i found myself feeling bad for watching it . there ' s no drama in this movie , because there is nothing to be felt . how can you film an action - acting scene like this ? that ' s something i wish i could do myself .

chucky is back but this time he is not scary ( a lot ) - but he is funny ! and he has the worst attitude i have ever seen at all , like a really bad movie . you should see that movie ! it gets worse after the first part of the movie . the acting is terrible and the acting is horrible . why did n't we know this ? i wish they would show this movie to us so we could laugh . the next thing i saw on the screen was this man dressed in dark sunglasses trying to make his way off the plane .

WTF!! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending?? The Notebook was good...but sheesh, enough with the depressing endings already. I'm told that he writes about realistic situations that people deal with in real life. Understandable...but sometimes it's nice to see people who have sacrificed their whole lives to only get to a mediocre unhappy time in their lives - to finally find the true meaning of happiness and are able to live it out for the rest of their days. Don't we already know what really happens in real life?

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons, and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out. I must admit, season one is by far the most underrated season, and this is the most underrated episode in season one.The episode begins with the family playing a game of Scrabble to get Bart ready for an intelligence test he needs to take at school. He says the game is stupid and he doesn't want to play it, but he needs to. He spells out a word that angers Homer and he chases Bart around the house.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to watch those movies too. If you're anything like me, and you probably are, you'll be laughing for years to come at the jokes in this movie. One of the funniest parts is when Gus sharks some money off a guy with kids and then the guy takes those kids into the forest like Hansel and Gretel then he and his wife go home with them. The soup scene kitchen is rife with comic genius of buffoonery: "Inspection officer -- Here!"

That this film flopped at the box office, and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today, is a great pity - yet somehow rather appropriate. The commercial suicide the Monkees committed by making this film is mirrored by the metaphorical suicide they commit on-screen. To destroy so brutally their carefully constructed image as a wholesome American alternative to the Beatles is courageous to the point of rashness, as is the admission of being no more than pawns in the entertainment industry, trapped (in the movie, literally) in their own artificiality.

it's a great movie for the whole family. i don't think many people have seen it cause i ask people and they say that they've never heard of it before. Sophie Heyman is my aunt's sister in law. my favorite scene is the whole movie i can't even pick a favorite scene. my favorite character is Hubert because he is a funny yet smart dog. if someone hasn't seen it they are missing out on a great adventure. i've only seen it cause my aunt is related to Sophie and she got a copy from her.

A film about the relationship between a man and leopard that's very reminiscent of "The English Patient," even down to a scene similar to when Ralph Fiennes' character carries the body of his lover across a desert-rock cliff. In "A Passion in the Desert," the main character carries the body of the leopard across a desert-rock cliff but in the opposite direction (calculated decision or unconscious contrast?). Historically expanded from a very short Balzac story, the film is not perfect but a treat no less. Final shot will haunt me for weeks.

has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating tv networks made it possible for people to produce new stories . this show was a classic , in - depth thriller based on the same genre of film and action that i enjoy watching . although this one is quite boring , it is nevertheless better than the alternative . it does not appear to have anything to do with any of the plot and the character . they seem to be trying to get as much out of the plot as they can . at first we assumed it was just a story about an unknown location .

as many of today ' s movies are guilty of , the plot is n ' t exactly stellar , the movie does n't make a lot of sense except that the characters in the film were very decent , they did their best . however there are some other factors which lead me to believe this film is based on the one i just saw on the tv . this film has been completely unsuitable and has not played out as it should have . the plot is too bad ; the lighting is off - key , and no one seems to pay any attention to what is going on outside the trailer .

at first i did n ' t think i would like this movie , but as it progressed it became better and more believable . the scene was good , there were some really funny jokes , but i could not put any of it together yet . finally i decided i needed to get something to write with , so i went through a stack of my old movies . i discovered that the best films are very good ones . i had no choice but to buy most of these movies for a nominal fee because they were only $ 2 , 000 worth .

all the characters in this cartoon were hilarious . norman the viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull and bones stories sounded like fun . this movie actually took me out of my groove and i felt as if i could have laughed at the scenes . i am going to try not to laugh at them , because i am not a good actor but i thought they were funny . i mean seriously , why would someone play a joke on their life ? after all , they live in a totally different world from us . there is no doubt about that .

this is a well directed columbo episode , with also some good character but the story just does n ' t really fit any of these situations . i ca n't wait to give it a try and see where it takes us . do not let me hear another example of what you are doing in the movie . i would hate to hear that there is going to be more crap like this happening in the sequel ( or worse ) . no matter . i have already given up on all of my efforts to find out why this film did not go as well as it might have turned out .

"Blind Spot" one of my festival favorites. I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers searching for a mysterious man who has loved and betrayed each of them in different ways. The cast is great. James Franco is particularly amazing as the broken-hearted boy from Los Angeles. His journal entries, which we hear in voice-over-narration, work well with the visuals and are quite intense. The film has a powerful style. It pushes elements like the road movie and revenge-drama in new directions. It also plays with time and perspective in ways that capture the frightening ambiance of lost love.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and more than reasonable elucidation for the genre. Personally I think he has been unfairly maligned throughout his career as an aesthete of gore. It's a pretty capable procedural and surprised me with its subtextually rich narrative that shows his distrust for small minded small-town mentality and the inefficiency of the police, as well as the twisted ideals of the Catholic church, the last of which seemed to have cut this film at its knees when it was first released and could have possibly given the director another direction so early on.

i still ca n ' t describe what to feel when i received this by the fnac site . such a rare treat . it would have been so much better if you just told me , instead of telling me . then i could have saved myself a trip back to the country and maybe seen a movie or two . but now i see that we may have to put on a production that does not take place until next week because of this one ! no way ! how is this even possible ? i think there should be at least 50 million dollars worth of film on that site .

Even after nearly 20 years apart, the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing. In this concert, they perform their best songs from their heyday (1970-1978), including "N.I.B. ", "War Pigs", and "Paranoid".Also included is priceless backstage footage with interviews and retrospectives into their days as the top hard rock band on the planet. The comments of Ozzy, Tony Iommi, Geezer Butler, and Bill Ward are just as interesting and intriguing to watch as the fabulous onstage performances.A must-see for all Sabbath and Ozzy fans.

this film biography of early rock and roll star buddy holly ( 1936 - 1959 ) is a tour de force for the band 's first tour . after several years , you will have to go in for your own reviews . i am looking forward to reading about it . if you can tell me who inspired the book , i would very much appreciate it . thank you for your time and good work . may i say something to you ? let us put together a story . . . please listen to all the stuff i was taught about the beatles ' music and how it affects the way they lived life .

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere, strikes him down dead, and keeps driving. The rest of the film is spent discovering who hit him, why he was hit, and what consequences this murder will have on the rest of the village. Separate Lies is a very British movie indeed. I'm not saying that hit-and-run car accidents are a particularly British phenomenon, but the way everyone reacts to this tragedy is very British. Tom Wilkinson plays James Manning, a hard-working, respectable citizen with a "stiff-upper-lip" attitude towards tragedy.

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

This is one of Chaplin's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more mature United Artists features. More opulent than the Mutual films, it continues Chaplin's quest for perfecting his comic expression. Most people forget that the film is actually a dream that Charlie has while awaiting being sent off to the front.There is plenty of slapstick via the Limburger cheese being used to gas the enemy, and Chaplin's foray into enemy territory dressed as a tree.By this stage in this career, the great man had become so immersed in filmic expression that his films give the impression of making themselves.

` ` pearl harbor , buddy . ' ' this movie is brilliant ! sure it does n ' t exactly flow like an indie blockbuster or any of that other stuff , but what do ya expect when you are watching a movie like this and find that there s just no room for anything else ? i swear it has to be made into some kind of sci - fi movie about a bunch of superheroes getting murdered by pirates and aliens . i mean really , how many people have had to carry a pirate around on a ship ?

my architect is a great film about nathaniel kahn ' s search for himself via the legacy of his famous architect , who ' s dead . when the story was first released ( and i didn ' t think it even had a title or anything ) , don ' t forget that this film was based on what was supposed to be a very good film . it does have the potential to bring in millions of dollars at least ! so far , i have n't seen a copy , nor did anyone pay me to see them .

` ` showtime ' ' is a funny film starring funnymen robert deniro ( meet the parents , a bronx tale ) in the early 1980s . but i do not see any movie like this on television or in movies from the 1980s . it is hard to imagine an actor doing anything similar to this movie . this was just another horror flick about a young boy in love with a woman . he goes out for a run and meets his girlfriend . they have some fun as they try to make their lives a lot more interesting .

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David. The actors seem like real people in this fairytale of the outside world meeting with mystical Shangra-la. It is a joy to watch Bobby Van, whose acting puts me in mind of Red Buttons, and, as always, George Kennedy (Cool-Hand Luke) who always manages to carry gravitas in his roles. The surprise here is Charles Boyer as the elder High Lama. Who would have known? All-star cast including Michael York and Olivia Hussey makes this work a keeper for those of us who cherish people.

i saw this movie on it ' s opening night , and enjoyed it . i probably would have enjoyed it a lot more if we were n't stuck here in the same town . as far as i was concerned , this was the most boring movie i had ever seen . when the movie ended , we walked to the bar where they were trying to make them another drink . the bartender , a tall man with curly red hair , offered me a beer . i asked for a coke and left the bar after that . i found a parking place and watched tv until i was almost tired .

that this film flopped at the box office , and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today , is only because of my lack of a sense of humor . " i turned from the camera to look at the group in the movie theater . i knew they had seen the film before , since they had been watching it just about every few days . i was pretty sure that i would never be able to get them out of my head , even if i tried . when we finally finished the movie with the show , i sat quietly in the booth and watched it for some time .

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen: much better and deeper than Luhrman's Romeo&Juliet or Spielberg's Titanic. Gerda's love impresses me every time, her search, her battle is exceptional. Gerda becomes a strong, loving woman throughout the movie. Kay is the poisoner of dark forces: the temptation. This story encourages me to fight like Gerda for the ONLY ONE, for the love of my life, for Mister Right. Patience is one of the keywords of this movie. I cry every time when I realize all the suffering of Gerda and Kay.

SHOWTIME is a mess, but it's an entertaining mess. The plot is forgettable, the satire is lightweight and the action sequences, though well-staged, aren't that exciting. But I laughed. A lot. Credit goes to the inspired pairing of De Niro and Murphy. They have great chemistry. Murphy delivers the one-liners, De Niro cracks us up with a look or grimace. This movie will get a RUSH HOUR-like reception from the critics. Don't listen to them. If you're a fan of De Niro or Murphy, you're going to enjoy this movie.

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80's, and this one is even better. Sylia, Nene, Linna, and Priss are all back as the Knight Sabers in their hard-suits battling the robotic boomers. The animation is crisp, the characters are well-developed, and the action rocks. Priss is a singer in her regular job, so the series features some wonderful songs as well. There is a fair amount of violence, but most of it is against robots, and there is some fan service, but nothing too racy.

the show start out with the boat . desmond was i it . then they went to try to save him . the only problem is that no one knew where the lead singer was or who was in the crew . there were quite a few scenes that did n't even remotely match the band . all of the other singers were very good , but there was some bad acting going on . the first two songs were really well and the director was pretty awesome , but he was much older than the other guys at the show .

I first saw The Victim (aka Out Of Contention) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. Being a passionate fan of Bewitched since I was a child, I loved to watch anything that starred Elizabeth Montgomery. This movie was (and still is) a real treat - whether you are a fan of Miss Montgomery's work or not. Elizabeth always shines in her roles, such as her portrayal as the rape victim in A Case Of Rape and as the suspected murderess in The Legend Of Lizzie Borden.

This is a funny movie. The Bob & Eddie Show feel of it could lead to a sequel but I doubt it will make enough money. Deniro proves he can be a great Straight man again with some hilarious and spontaneous moments. Eddie was fun to watch working with people instead of CGI animals and rodents. Rene Russo- well she's just fun to watch anyway and she's played her part excellent.Some wild and unusual stunts, especially the garbage truck scene. This was worth seeing in the theater. We needed a good laugh and got many from the movie and the great out-takes at the end.

As many of today's movies are guilty of, the plot isn't exactly stellar, the movie doesn't move anyone, and certainly this won't warrant any award (outside of Blockbusters' perhaps)...but then again, who really cares.Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro team up to produce a very funny, at times hilarious, movie that I really enjoyed. Russo and Shatner played their small parts well as well. Man, I hope in the future my wife ages as well as Miss Renee has.Moving along, this "buddy" cop-flick produces high laughs in a reasonable amount of time.

A well written screenplay. A moving story showing the middle class English at it's best. Some great acting by Tom Wilkinson and Emily Watson. Tom Wilkinson is one of Britain's best actors. He knows how to be subtle and honest. Emily Watson is an actress I was not familiar with, but to her credit she does a great job of playing the ****** wife. The director, Julian Fellowes did not succumb to the typical Hollywood gimmicks to give the film some meaty storyline. It has not over dramatized it's portrayal of the English middle class.

this film is not really a remake of the 1949 o ' brien film ( which is excellent ) . it borrows nothing but a lot of bad acting , in a way . however , it makes me feel a bit disappointed in the movie since i have seen lots of awful things happen and many people die because of that movie . however , the plot is awesome . for example , on the first night i met my wife , she got very drunk with a bunch of old men and they had a little party where they came up with some funny new stories .

The cover of the VHS says it all: "Without doubt, the most powerful movie of its kind since the Texas Chainsaw Massacre". I'm a huge fan of 70's and 80's slashers and I have to say, I agree 100 %. The characters are believable, the actors have an excellent charm (especially George Kennedy as the forest-ranger). There's the twisted atmosphere, that only TCM has, an astounding soundtrack to reflect the emotions and the filming locations that are the most beautiful in the history of horror.

better than it has any right to be , this movie died a quick and painful death at the american theater in 1997 . the plot is simple , just as i had hoped . there are all kinds of characters who do have some serious issues , and no matter how much you try to put on the film , you ca n't stop it . this movie is the kind of bad - boy movie that makes people want to watch it instead of watching it . if you can get a laugh out of this , you may be able to read the whole episode and figure out what really went wrong .

When the trailer for Accepted first came up, many people began to get excited about seeing it... really excited. Who could blame them, it looked like fun. But that's exactly the thing. People went into Accepted looking for a good movie, but if you think about it, Accepted isn't the type of film destined to be a good movie. It's meant to be a film that pleases its crowd without too much effort being given. That being said, for those of you who expected a great film, you need to think about what could be made of a comedy like this one.

so it ' s not an award winner , so what ? have you ever wanted to see a film that is more important than making a movie ? well , this movie is even better than the first one . it ' s only half the production . it ' s all going to be like this ; it ' s as if the plot is just out of focus . there are so many flaws and minor changes in the story that we didn ' t realize how much work it took to get the plot set up .

I'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci's films. Most of his 80s gore films had their moments, but often came across as second-rate Dario Argento imitations. With the exception of the entertaining "Zombi" (which was a George Romero imitation), I didn't really enjoy them. I know Italian horror often disregards the plot, but the storyline and characters in his films were just far too thread bare even by the standards. This is why "Don't Torture a Duckling" surprised me. Its actually a very well made film with an engrossing murder mystery.

I wonder why I haven't heard of this movie before. It's truly a magnificent comedy (I'd say farce, but it's too well acted and I'd hate to denigrate it's quality). A comedic character study about the travails of mid-life crises, the inequity for gays who can't have their long-time unions recognized, and the general differences of people who can't fit nicely into society, that pairs Kathy Bates and Rupert Everett to a wonderful effect. Forget Julia Roberts and Rupert; Kathy Bates and Rupert should do another movie together.

the movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency . putney swope is on the board for promoting the film and his name is written on the board to keep up appearances . i have never seen this before , but i suppose you would n't be too surprised to see it on your website in the early 1970s . there were some interesting things happening around the station that day , but they are all forgotten by the end of the show . i just happened to be watching it and decided to watch it out of curiosity .

warning - - this film has some amazingly graphic images and should never be seen by kids . the artist who this story depicts is , in fact , a guy from the university of iowa who is not only a nazi but also a jew . i can see why you would agree that there are some interesting people on this movie , especially after what it looks like when it gets to be a reality show ; but if you do n't watch this , you might well end up missing your first big treat as a filmmaker .

this is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people would n ' t like it . most of the time i was just surprised that they could make such a good film , especially when there was no actual production going on . as the credits rolled , it felt like everyone else in the movie seemed to be taking their cues from the plot and making suggestions . it 's hard to describe what i saw because i found myself wondering what kind of man would get his hands on so much material in such an awful manner .

* may contain spoilers * the first time i saw this movie was when it was re - released on video when i was about 12 . my parents had to get me to watch it for another week or two before i felt like i could go back to school . i had no idea that this movie would be so depressing ! i loved the story of the woman in red who was found dead by a group of police officers . this movie was not only sad but stupid . it did n't even have a musical quality to it at all . what were the real effects ?

i agree that this is one of the very best episodes of the entire series - - my only detraction would be if i had been able to watch it without having to leave home for a few days . it was so disappointing to sit through the entire movie , even in the first chapter , and really do n't like it until i get to see the next scene . i guess there are some things you can live with - the bad ones , or the good ones . when i look back on it , i 'm amazed by what i just watched .

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange. I was confused, sad and happy in the same moment. I guess that too less people will pay attention to this movie. But I hope that at least a few will see it and get something out of it. The story of two friends, linked by their suffers of bodily disability, whom (as a team) beat the medical well-fare system and fight for their rights. This movie shows a side which some of us would never understand, not too exaggerated but emotional presented.

another go round with the monkey king going west . . . . sort of . beginning in the middle of some action the movie has no ending and all i see are people getting shot . one thing that scares me the most is not being an actor . i would rather have been an actress on a beach in africa , than be a film critic . if you wanted to make a movie as bad as mine , this was the only way i could think of to make something like that happen . at least it was for me .

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war. Everything about the movie was perfect. I just saw the movie yesterday and I want to get my own DVD asap and watch it many times over. The story ends as it started I was very happy that he came back and I was proud of her for becoming a doctor and fulfilling her father's dream. She honored her father, boyfriend-husband, and her lover. The character had many shades. Christian Bale is also an phenomenal actor. Some stories do have happy endings.

no , i have not seen the original series and i wo n ' t compare the two if i had . it 's all a little much to say about this movie . but you can see why i like it as much as i hate it at the same time . who wants to watch something they saw on television with the only other person alive in the entire world ? maybe i should start with that one ! well , here goes . there is a guy and his girlfriend were married and she died after having sex with another man .

this is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary i have ever seen ! the images that are shown , however , are all in so many shades of white as to be almost disturbing . there is not one single line that does not lead from the end of this film to an ending . it is incredibly hard to believe that we were able to witness such a great movie when we did not even know the name of the star or what it was about . how could we watch this ? how could we see any other movies that were like this ?

great show ! about time a reality tv show comes along that closes generation gaps . contestants range in ages from ten to twelve years old . one of the few things my dad never let me watch was this movie , or did n't see it . i 'm so disappointed because i thought it would make for a good movie . if i am reading this script correctly , it is pretty much the same as being in the past . the cast is actually better than any of these people . they also seem to have some real talent . i wonder what happens to them once they are out of this place .

I hope, from his seat on Heaven's comedic throne, Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film, as Terence Ryan and Ken Tuohy have taken a book that the author himself said writing it "nearly turned me mad" into a joy to watch.The film tells the story of the Irish town of Puckoon and the problems befallen upon it when the partition between Northern Ireland and the Republic is drawn up, cutting its way through the centre of the village and, more worringly, through the middle of the churchyard.

First off, I absolutely loved this movie. As a Billy Crystal fan, I must say that I was expecting more comedic situations than I actually got. However, it was nice to see him in a role with more depth and emotion. His portrayal of talent agent Sammy was brilliantly performed and uniquely him. In addition, Gheorghe Muresan (as Maximus) was superb in his first film role. When Sammy goes to Romania to visit his client on location he has his world turned upside down. He never expected that he would accidentally find the one person who could change his life.

Chucky is back but this time he is not scary (a lot) - but he is funny!When Chucky is brought back to life (in the doll, of course) by his old trailer trash girlfriend, Tiffany, he promptly kills her and transforms her into a doll, too. Tiffany and Chucky are now on the case of 2 high school graduates - eekkk! !Don't miss this film - it is a whole lot of fun. It is scary, funny, weird, wacky and stupid all in one!My rating : 9/10.

i never heard of architect , louis kahn , until this documentary . in this almost two hour documentary which you should be happy about , don orlando d'oro ' s death seems a little over the top . unfortunately , he had a terrible accident when his car rolled off the road , so i ca nt believe that don ' t even know why it happened . not only that , but it ' s just unbelievable to me that my brother was able to survive the fall down a side - street and into a garbage dumpster . i would hate for someone like don ' t play at being famous .

I first saw "Signs of Life" on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation. It's a wonderfully written, ensemble production with terrific performances by Michael Lewis as Joey and Vincent D'Onofrio as his brother, Daryl. Arthur Kennedy, in one of his last roles, is also excellent as an aging shipbuilder whose family business is about to close. The rest of the cast which includes Beau Bridges, Kathy Bates and Mary-Louise Parker give remarkable clarity and substance to their characters.The direction is subtle and effective. I've watched this movie several times over the years and would very much recommend it.

i have to admit i had never heard of this movie . i caught it last night on tmc . i am really surprised that my dad actually liked it . i guess you can tell he has a soft spot for old films and , like most older films , he did not want to spoil this one when he went to see it with the kids . if you could only see this movie , i would die of boredom . i got a call from him just as i was coming home from dinner and i realized that something was bothering him .

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films, it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment. The most noticed element of the film is its silence; no one speaks. I don't think Besson, despite what is evident in most of his later work, meant it as any kind of cool gimmick. I think what makes it so clever and so effective is the fact that with no other way of communicating, everyone has to read each other based on intuition and conveying of emotion, no matter how slight.

i always liked listening to buddy holly and felt a real loss when he was killed at a young age . i think i would have loved to watch this movie with one of the greatest indie bands on the planet . i do n't really understand why they bothered to make it in such short order . i just ca n't see what is so great about the story . all i care about is that these characters are good actors who go out and do good things , but instead of being good , they get killed in an ambush by bad guys from the evil army .

Hey all you jive hustlers, you stone foxes, you mean dudes. Watch out cause Slaughter is back in town! If you are looking for a bad-ass, funky film to watch some night, this is just right. 'Slaughter' is back and trying to take it easy n' relax after his adventures down in Mexico. But if you are a narrow-minded gangster like 'Duncan', you are bound to seek revenge. Why, I don't know. Was 'Hoffo' in the first one his brother or what? Any who.

I don't see that much wrong with this movie. Granted, the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti and Maria Callas, but they can certainly carry a tune. Burt Bacharach and Hal David are talented songwriters and I happen to love their songs, especially "The World Is A Circle", "The Things That I Will Not Miss", and "Question Me An Answer". Some people claim that Hermes Pan's choreography is ghastly and that the snowy mountain sets look as if they were made of plastic; I disagree on both counts.

the movie is based on a jules verne book i actually have read once , about ten years ago . this film is also based on an in - person movie . there are just too many people for me to figure out how to stop it ; so i went back to reading the screenplay and getting some ideas as to why i chose this film . first of all i am very impressed by its content . it has great dialogue and a plot that was well executed . the lines seem to be much better then any i have seen in films like this one .

this is a good film , no doubt , but with some odd aspects . without spoiling anything it takes about five minutes to complete and there are a few more parts that are not quite as much fun . most of the credits are still in the back of my mind and even though i had a couple hours to watch , i found that i enjoyed watching this film . the plot and dialogue are so different and yet you find yourself liking the movie . i liked it a lot better from the beginning because of the plot which was very interesting .

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade. She smokes and drinks. She doesn't have a lot of friends and she has a nagging mother(Beverly D'Angelo). Jade finds herself growing closer to her mom's boyfriend Billy(Rob Estes), maybe she is attracted to him. Of course, I don't need to tell you what happens after that. This is probably my favorite TV movie. This movie shows that sometimes everyone is to blame. This movie also has the best acting that I have seen in TV movies.

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear we all have. Fear of rejection, fear of intimacy and most importantly fear of our own inadequacies.The three lead actors, Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo are match well to their roles and are excellent. It was a joy to witness the dynamic between the three of them as it seemed real.I believe Barbora Bobulova is a stand out. I hope we see much more of her in the coming years.This film doesn't take the easy way out.

This is a good film, no doubt, but with some odd aspects. Without spoiling anything it takes place in 3 places only- a Sicilian farm, the boat,and Ellis Island New York. All shots are close up so we never see a broad sweep of anything. I wonder if this was to save money? No street scenes anywhere, and we don't even see the boat except in close ups. And the music...what on earth was going on with playing Nina Simone songs, decades before they were out?

probably the best horror movie in 5 years.. there's been lame remakes, attempts to make you scared (when all they make you do is walk out of the theater) and movies that just shouldn't have been made. but this one is worth it. the only reason i didn't give it a 10 is because Paris Hilton is in it (but her death scene makes up for it, believe me)....so here they are.. the SPOILERS of all the death scenes in the movie..1. my favorite death scene ever - Paris Hilton's!

this film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918 . in fact , many of the best films i have seen were made by a young boy . there is a sequel to this one , but it is not much better than this film . for example , on the way back to my room in the basement of the castle i had to pass a couple of people with cameras who seemed to be getting ready to take photos of me - i think it will be a shame if you get captured again .

Containing Billy's famous humor, this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure, pleasantly unexpectedly so for Billy Crystal. This movie has different tear-jerker, dramatic, serious underlying themes (particularly with a scene with Steven Seagal). This movie was both entertaining and serious, a movie about lost love, about relationships with father-son, husband-wife, about friendship and values with a good dose of humor thrown in, especially at the beginning. The balance between drama and comedy isn't always maintained as with the new classical genre of this type, but the real message and motivation for this movie remains solid.

the buddy holly story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink . there 's not a lot going on . this is all just a show to me , as if it were something i had ever seen before . but what was really going on was the fact that none of us knew one another , or at least anyone that had been in the picture when it appeared on the television . i am still looking for anything to say about either of the two guys from the pool party , who have been in my life for such a short time .

I wasn't expecting a great deal from this film, so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it and found it to be most noteworthy. It's noteworthiness is mainly due to the talent and appeal of it's star, John Garfield.Garfield plays Jack, a boxing star who is framed for murder. He must go on the run, and ends up out in the sticks with Gloria Dickson and the Dead End Kids. Here is offered a chance for redemption, yet will the past catch up with him yet? Garfield was an actor ahead of his peers.

A very weird, psychedelic, esoteric, (and did I say weird? :) experience.But on at least on one level - it did exactly what it was supposed to do. It bridged the gap between the silly, manufactured, Hollywood look at teen pop idols that was the Monkees TV program and the adult, musically growing and evolving, and yet still a little silly Monkees of the '70s and beyond.The most important line in the film is Mike Nesmith's, "If they think we are plastic now, wait till they see how we do it."

I've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie. I agree the move had many opportunities for improvement but unlike all those who are looking for the perfect movie with the perfect songs and the best acting, I was looking for something a bit different and this movie gave it to me. I watched this movie not as a critic but as a person looking for a little hope, a little cheer, a bit of a release from my everyday life, and this is what I got.

david attenborough brings his fascination of wild life , this time the creatures under the sea , in this extraordinary world as if he were looking for the golden gate . i ca n't imagine it is possible for a man to be afraid enough to go to the beach and even more terrified than i am by all that we are experiencing today . however , they are nothing compared to what i see before me . there is an alien ship , but it looks like a spaceship from a different galaxy . i have never seen such an alien spacecraft in my entire life ' s life . "

He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song, and now the terrific Justin Lee Collins wanted to reunite the cast members and maybe some crew of one of his favourite TV shows as a kid, The A-Team. The only member he wouldn't be able to get was the late great George Peppard who played main character Col. John "Hannibal" Smith, but he did get some kind of psychic to try and help. He did manage to reunite all members including Dirk Benedict (Lt. Templeton "Faceman" Peck #2) who went to Celebrity Big Brother in 2007, Dwight Schultz (Capt.

despite of all the negative criticism i really enjoyed this movie . i am not saying this lightly . i want everyone to know how much fun this movie is . that movie was absolutely nothing but bad news . my best friend , beth , has a real talent for this movie ( as you can imagine ) , but she is not the best actress on the face of the earth . she does not seem to have the ability to make any money and even if she did , what could she do to make it up to the people who are in control ?

i love the tv contest . hate to see it end . there are so many talented contestants . it just seems like they have no control over what happens when they walk out of here , which would be funny if it was n't for that ridiculous story about a group of young japanese people who live in japan and start going into their house while the television hosts are doing whatever it is they do . i think they 're having an awful time living in japan . i got ta admit i had a little trouble keeping track of everything in the show .

the ` ` all i have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring . . . ' ' scene was a riot . i just could n't get it up ! ' , and then he gave me a few lines of dialogue to play on the film . " " this is the second one we have made today . what happened to this one ? how did they make it ? " she asked . " where was this movie filmed ? " " i am not sure yet . it is still in print . you will hear from me about it when you meet me . "

i saw this film at a small screening . even though it had a low budget , the creative direction was great . i mean , i am very talented and can not help but be fascinated by this film . i love all those scenes where there is so much to get done . if you enjoy this film , please do not hesitate to return to my email address to see me with your recommendations . i should like to say that it was a huge shock when i heard of it . it is one of the first movies we have watched in the series for the purpose of watching other movies in the series .

although this film never attained commercial notoriety , my experience has led me to conclude that many well - done pieces of material such as these should be seen at least once in a lifetime rather than the first three . so what do you make of this ? i must say that it is not very good . here it is ( if you can imagine a movie like this ! ) and i am about to pay a lot of money to see it without the benefit of cable . there are some movies that are great and others that are just boring , which is one of the worst shows ever created .

it ' s showtime ! showtime is simply a bump in eddie murphy and robert deniro ' s careers . it ' s hard to comprehend that these two heroes are the worst villains i have ever seen . the movie has an unappealing quality , as if the actors were trying very hard to pull together a plot that would fit in with what they were doing . it is not good at all , and when the cast decides to put one on , they can ' t quite grasp what is being played out . you could ' t tell the difference between the two .

valeria , an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and ignorance . she is the very first woman i ever really met in new york . but when she was introduced to me , it became clear that she is just shy of six feet five inches tall and looks like a movie star with short brown hair and piercing blue - gray eyes . although she has great physical attractiveness , there is something about her that makes me not like her at all . what could be so bad ?

at one time ` buddy cop ' movies ruled the box office . it seemed that every summer flocks of tourists went in to see the films . the film is good for kids , and when it comes out , there was a great deal of confusion about what to expect . i think they were pretty disappointed . i could n't blame them - we were just kids . but this particular movie was much different from any i have ever seen or been shown . it was very romantic , and made no attempt to get my mind off of things that might have otherwise occupied it .

I know this movie isn't for everyone, and I won't push my opinions on you, but what I have to say is the truth about how many people feel about this movie...It was the best I have ever seen!!! It was soooooooooooooooooo funny, and even though it wasn't the scariest movie I had ever seen, it kept me on the edge of my seat, because I didn't know what was gonna happen next. If you like funny scary movies, you have got to see this one!

Being American, I have not been exposed to this character before, which is good because some of you have been disappointed. I have nothing to compare it to. I have found no enjoyment in the mindless idiot humor in the American teen movies, and although this is a slightly similar type of humor, I couldn't stop laughing. I hardly ever laugh out loud at a movie. And usually a movie has a few funny parts for me, but this movie was funny from start to finish. My only disappointment was when it was over.

Oh I remember watching this show at 4:00 p.m. during my junior high days. It was not a pleasant experience because I remember watching it when I made my homework.Still, the show caught my attention when Alex displayed her special powers and dealt with the typical junior high problems.But the show wasn't all about adventures and special powers; it was more of an educational effort for a younger audience in order to get more interested in school and biology overall.The lead actress (can't remember her name and I'm too lazy to copy and paste from the main details) delivered a fantastic performance.

` ` nuovomondo ' ' was a great experience . many filmmakers tell their stories to a big extent via dialogue . these filmmakers are not very successful . in the original , they were able to film a good story , but so far this is no improvement at all . every day i get one of these filmmakers who takes an interest in a story and makes it his or her favourite , he or she will try to work it out for themselves . that just does not work . we can not think of what any of the others might like to see if they could .

first off , i absolutely loved this movie . as a billy crystal fan , i must say that i really enjoyed it . the plot and characters were so funny . it reminded me of someone i know . his name is steve thompson and i have to say that he was good at whatever he did ( even better than i had guessed . ) what i like least about this movie is that it was made by a very small town person who would be too shy to say anything but " i love this movie . " i think it 's pretty cool how they make it look good .

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something "not human" is portraying human beings and I think that this film is one of them. Apart from a few points of the plot and the characters - this film could be changed with all people rather than mainly animals. Although - it's good someone did not - I feel the cats are jolly good in this film portraying humans! :-)This film also focuses on quite a lot of adult issues - which is rather odd for a Disney film.

spike milligan ' s books and plays have defeated film makers over the years , and 2002 ' s ' puckoon ' is a different story altogether . if you ' ve never seen an action - thriller , i think you wouldn ' t want to watch it . it ' s pretty awful . in fact , it ' s not much better than this . i found it at smashwords and saw all the good movies that don ' t come close to this one . it has great dialogue , very few character references , and quite frankly no dialog whatsoever .

(Synopsis) Graduating high school senior Bartleby "B" Gaines (Justin Long) finds himself without a college to attend. He has been able to talk and con his way out of every problem he encounters, but he hasn't been able to charm his way pass the college admissions board of eight colleges. His mom and dad are very disappointed that Bartleby hasn't been accepted into college. His parents think that if Bartleby doesn't go to college, he will have no future. Several of Bartleby's friends are in the same situation of being rejected by all the colleges they applied to.

i saw the trailer and read some reviews , and i had low expectations for this movie . i was expecting a big - screen show , and there was no surprise in that . i had never watched such an amazing movie before ; it was more like a horror movie than anything else . the first character was a man who had to have been on the stage at least twice . then there was this poor kid who was beaten up so bad that he must have walked around for hours without getting his butt kicked .

As a film buff, I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny, sarcastic comments about this film (my favourite being Woody Allen's quip "If I had my life to live over again I wouldn't change anything ... except for seeing the musical remake of Lost Horizon"). Therefore I've never been able to watch it without smirking at the choreography/set/songs etc. Just recently I came across a widescreen DVD and watched it for the first time in years, along with a friend who had never heard of the film's reputation.

The film isn't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch. I am the first one to agree that Victor Fox isn't really that attractive and his music and style are pretty cheesy. I also agree that the film has some odd distractions and some scenes don't work well. So what? If it makes you smile and you enjoy it who cares? Does every film have to make sense? Does every film have to be perfect? No. A person could get razed admitting that they love this film. Again, so what?

After spotting the boat at the end of the previous episode ("Three Minutes"), the survivors are shocked to find out who the occupant is. With the use of the boat, Jack and Sayid come up with a plan to confront "The Others". However, when Jack, Sawyer, Kate and Hurley follow Michael to "The Others", Jack is forced to reveal Michael's deadly secret whilst they are in the middle of nowhere.Meanwhile, Locke decides that the time has come to find out the time has come to find out what will happen if "the button" is not pressed.

The Aristocats is really quite charming, and is rated far too low on IMDb. The songs aren't as memorable as the ones in the Jungle Book, but they weren't bad at all. The animation is really lovely, the best sequence being the landscape of Paris in general. It looked beautiful. This is probably Disney's most relaxing animation I think, and as another reviewer quite rightly said, who doesn't love cats? Another great piece of animation was O' Malley looking into Duchess's eyes, as their romance was so believable while not obvious.

very touching film , a great surprise to come up from brazil , a country that usually exports features about 40 years in the future . you have no idea of what it was like living in a country where only 60 men lived . i never really enjoyed any of this stuff ( except for my mother ) but there was no way i was ever going to stop watching it on the cable news channel . it was n't even funny at first . everyone in the world laughed and joked as we went through our morning routine , so why should i feel special ?

louis khan was one of the most influential architects of our time , and this film speaks volumes about how much we care about his greatness . for the first two or three films i watched , i never imagined i would be viewing a movie featuring a great man who seemed so far removed from what he actually was . even though it was not really as bad as expected , i have always been intrigued by the acting and storyline . there are some interesting character - type features that are very interesting to watch , but this is no different .

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film (which is excellent). It borrows the main premise--a man has been poisoned and spends the rest of the film trying to find his killer. But I like that the writers chose an English professor, instead of a private dick, as the protagonist. The plot is also quite original. In general, the film moves along fast enough to keep you awake. But what mars this film is a strange dated quality about it (probably due to the horrendous 80's original music score)combined with an affected "noir" feel.

the a - team is still repeating every day on dutch television ( rtl7 , around 1800hrs ) and i still watch it . i love it ! but i do n't see why we get to watch it . not only does it make me uneasy , but it also lets me know how stupid i was to allow you to watch it . " " so what are you going to do with the video ? " peter asked . 
 " well , there has been some change in the rules . i did not tell you because i was afraid that you would never trust it enough to see it .

What a shame this movie was never released. (It is now playing on cable.) I tuned in based on my high regard for the stars and was rewarded by seeing a movie far better than the ones I've been paying to see in theatres recently. I like to be surprised. So often movies are marketed as "offbeat," but are in fact more of the same old recycled drivel. This movie is genuinely different, with the bonus of a heartwarming message. Jonathan Pryce sings like an angel.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I've seen in a very long time. Granted I spent much of the first half an hour wondering what the hell was going on but once I had accepted that I would never understand everything from the subtitles I was able to enjoy the film.Can you really hate a film where a staff turns into a flock of birds that defecate over the enemy? What does character development matter when faced with a lesbian alien princess whose people built the pyramids? Why does Buddha wear seriously blinging diamond earrings?

this movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war . everything about the movie was perfect . the characters were perfect and , although not all that interesting , the plot was good . overall the plot was very interesting and i guess you will agree that it did n't really matter if the characters were actors or directors . i do n't think anyone could have come close to being able to duplicate this . the acting is pretty good , but the dialogue is way beyond what we can see at a real western theater .

"A Slight Case of Murder" is an excellent TV movie, which is defiantly worth the price of a rental. William H. Macy is great as a movie critic who accidentally kills his mistress, and then has to try to conceal the crime. Although that may sound dark, the film is actually quite light hearted and funny, with many memorable lines ("Acting is harder than I thought- you ever see BODY HEAT? I think I owe Bill Hurt an apology" and my personal favourite "For next week answer these two questions about film noir, What do these people do during the day?

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh: as the Monkees reduce their entire career to a one-minute TV commercial about dandruff! See: the 50 foot Victor Mature try to figure out what the heck he's doing in this film! Hear: Frank Zappa (with his pet cow on leash) tell Davey Jones "Your music is awfully white"! Experience: the Monkees' only live performance as a real rock band play the honest-to-gosh first-ever real punk-rock song (Circle Sky)! Listen: as Davey Jones sings a Harry Nielsen song about having a transsexual father!

years ago i read the book ' a maquina ' ( the machine ) . as i re - read this little book , i am amazed by the way it is written and how you can get away with using it in so many ways , just by doing the whole thing again . what a mess ! the only thing of any substance that 's worth reading here is the fact that the story is basically a complete waste of time and energy . after all , there is something about the story that gets stuck on your brain .

by convincing the prime minister to back the totally unsuitable ali g as a candidate for staines in the local news . we were told that ali g and his wife had died of cancer while they were living in australia , and the only way to get it was to take out an old friend of mine . the plot was good though , the film was very good , i did not want to let anyone down , i found it fascinating . after a while , i asked myself , what is going to happen now ?

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen, However, I am only in the second season.The typical Columbo activities are both amusing and irritating. His cigar ashes causing him trouble have been seen before, And the bit where he always identifies in some way with the murderer--in this case cooking ,Tho the scene on the TV cooking show distracted from the main theme.Also not explained was why the brother at the beginning of the show was cutting part of the wires of the mixer. The reason was never explained ,nor did it serve any purpose.

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time. Excellent original music, clever, heady...it's hard to be articulate about something this good. There isn't one character that you don't instantly love to watch- Myronex "Putney, there's trouble in the black room!" "My name is Rufus." The lines, thrown away left and right, are classics themselves, recalling Slapshot, Caddyshack, Anchorman, Repoman, Dolemite, any comedy whose dialog is not of the formulaic set-up punchline variety. "Putney, Myronex called you tasteless!"

i ' ve got to say it . gary busey saved this film . if it were not for his fine , well - known character , this movie probably would have been done in three weeks instead of four . the director was a real bitch and even though the film was good , he is only able to give us some basic ideas of what it would have been like to be there . we were on our way to meet one of gary busey ' s best friends in a dive bar . the place was full of other guys who seemed to really enjoy themselves .

William H. Macy always gives a good performance. He never looks lazy and never seems like he'd rather be somewhere else. In short, he's what more actors should be like. "A Slight Case of Murder" is directed by Steven Schachter, who went on to do two more great films with Macy (Door to Door, The Wool Cap).Television movies have long been a dump of overdone acting, poor cinematography, and sub-par scripting. That's why it's so refreshing to see a TV movie that does exactly what it's sort of film was created for.

Jeff Garlin's film is filled with heart and laughter. As in Curb Your Enthusiasm, his screen persona is hilarious; but in addition we get to see both warmth and a sense of emotional vulnerability that makes the story universal. While the film chronicles his character's dreams of love, performing success, and weight loss, it will appeal to anyone who dreams of a better life. The supporting cast brings the frustrations and joys of his life to the screen in funny and heartbreaking ways. The simple joys of food, friendship, and trying once again once life has disappointed us are all themes.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu, being Greek I adore my country and I liked the flattering director's point of view. Based on a true story during the years when Greece was struggling to stand on her own two feet through war, Nazis and hardship. An Italian soldier and a Greek girl fall in love but the times are hard and they have a lot of sacrifices to make. Nicholas Cage looking great in a uniform gives a passionate account of this unfulfilled (in the beginning) love.

Just as in "Columbo" we see the fatality occur right at the beginning. What follows is an escalating web of lies, sex, blackmail, and murder. The investigating officer, Adam Arkin, is even somewhat of a fumbler, not unlike "Columbo". It is William H. Macy, as the movie critic suspect who carries the film. Constantly twisting and turning, the plot sends Macy deeper and deeper into the quicksand of his "perfect crime". William H. Macy fans will enjoy "A Slight Case Of Murder", as will those who like crime capers with all kinds of delicious possibilities.

I will admit, I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film, and after about 5 - 10 minutes into it, I felt like many did. I was expecting a Monkey movie that was similar to the television show, but instead I was given... well, I didn't know what I was given to be honest.However, after finally watching this film, I realized that not only had I had a closed mind to the brilliance it depicts, I also found myself watching it over and over again.

Can the intensity of a husband's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime,despite betrayal on many levels? Tom Wilkinson is no brutal Othello, in the setting of modern day England. So, gradually a web of deceit begins to be woven. And, we witness cycles of jealousy and drunkenness and guilt and fornication. And so the web of "separate lies" begins to fail and then hold together again. And life (and death) goes on, despite the bright flame of the husband's love and the deep despair and guilt woven into so many lives.

when i saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy american movie done on the cheap with appalling quality , and not so much of an original comedy . but this movie has some real action from the characters in it . although the film is one of the worst horror flicks i have ever seen , the plot is actually a lot better than the crap they told me about . maybe this is n't so bad after all ! oh , and there was something really wrong with this movie that i am not aware of . what do you think about this movie ?

(Some spoilers included:)Although, many commentators have called this film surreal, the term fits poorly here. To quote from Encyclopedia Britannica's, surreal means:"Fantastic or incongruous imagery": One needn't explain to the unimaginative how many ways a plucky ten-year-old boy at large and seeking his fortune in the driver's seat of a red Mustang could be fantastic: those curious might read James Kincaid; but if you asked said lad how he were incongruous behind the wheel of a sports car, he'd surely protest, "NO way!"

when ` ` madame ' ' decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble . the snobbish butler edgar who has been keeping a watchful eye on her does not see what is right in front of him . i should add that she is totally and completely delusional . she claims to have some kind of brain condition that is causing her to hallucinate . although it is hard to be sure with such high technology as this , i believe she is telling the truth . but there is something very strange and very scary about it all .

jack , sawyer and sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted desmond . his traumatic past experience with people he does not know has given him a shock . what follows is a scene which shows desmond trying to catch a fish in a net . instead , he catches one . when the fish tries to crawl out , desmond smashes it over the head with a piece of broken tackle . desmond finds himself trapped in a pool of water . he falls into the water and begins to float . " that 's all you can do ? "

this little film is hysterical , full of stereotypes about gays , straights , dwarfs , british tea and pubs etc . the movie starts with an old woman being told that she has a baby coming in two months and there is not enough time to give it a name . she ends by saying that she ca n't take it seriously , that maybe it should just be a book or some kind of play - by - play documentary from one of the old days . no matter what happened , this was certainly one of the worst comedies i ever saw .

i was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange . i was confused , sad and embarrassed . it made me want to cry . the film had a bad title . i felt sorry for people who are in such a dark mood . the plot was about a boy and his mother who met in a nightclub . she started to feel that something bad had happened to her and she tried to get out . she ran into an attractive young man when he first came to los angeles but he would never allow her to see him .

loved today ' s show ! ! ! it was a variety and not solely cooking ( which would have been my first choice but , unfortunately , i had no way of reading the titles ) . i can still hear the music playing over the loudspeakers , but i ca n't quite make out whatever it is . i don ' t know who the composer was singing , or even if he really wanted to be there , because the lyrics just didn ' t make much sense at this point . all i can say is that this is the best show i have ever watched in my life .

This little film is hysterical, full of stereotypes about gays, straights, dwarfs, British tea and pubs, American gun culture, divorce and marriage; yet, it manages to be sensitive to the issues surrounding each. Kathy Bates is "Amazing" Grace Beasley, and as a character actor of staggering range, she brings her considerable comedic talent to ground this somewhat unusual film as she did in Fried Green Tomatos. With the help of other comedic talents like Dan Akroid as Max, her ex-lawyer husband and the backdrop of downtown Chicago and rural England, the story is just intriguing enough to entertain.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan, where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion. I really admired the story and visual approach. The action is frightening and the mood of loneliness that the film projects is amazing. There is much beauty in the melancholy that surrounds these three misfit heroes. Not just in the desert but in the city too. My best scene was after the boy discovers his friends in the apartment and then rides his skateboard through all the remarkable lights of the city. You really feel for this guy.

if you have n ' t seen this film , do it . its a genremix as i ' ve never seen another like it . in the first chapter there are three men and one woman who are completely different from the others . both of them are young and good looking , and they appear to be very much in love , but they are having difficulty keeping up with what is being said . the protagonist is just shy of twenty years old and has long black hair and piercing blue eyes that make him look like a pirate .

was very fortunate to see the movie hari om at the bermuda international film festival . it was the opening act for the director of the film which i loved . after the first scene the director did n't make it back in time and i saw him with his head down on a log , crying away in the rain . he has so many tears left over that this movie makes me want to weep just to hear what he is thinking . why am i looking at this movie because it seems like it is worth a lot of money ?

surprisingly effective british drama about two very different people who find common ground , and in particular the ` ` flowering ' plot ' of this movie . when you have to see it with your own eyes , it seems like a waste of time . why ca n't we just move on ? after all , what does this movie really accomplish ? i thought that was the first thing the film was supposed to be about . well , obviously i was mistaken because it is not about the sex scene . it is about them trying to get over their bad behavior , and they are forced to work together to make it work .

after a somewhat slow start i thought this movie about the italian occupation of a greek island during world war ii was pretty funny . but not in the least . i wanted to feel sorry for the guy who was being killed in it , but i do n't know if it was the film or how much of an attempt it made on my life . i just wanted to believe that one thing would have kept me from having to live through the entire series . as we get closer to its conclusion , i think i am going to vomit again .

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I've ever seen. Not only it's the mother of coincidence, but also every time that you think you can set up the whole puzzle in your head, the story takes a completely new direction.Take this casualty for example, The US marine, whom gives Sayid the way to become a Torturer, Is Clancy Brown, playing a character named Joe Inman. In the last episode, he is playing Kelvin Inman, the Desmond partner in the Hatch. Destiny, uh?

this film , like much of their music , is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer . it makes me want to punch somebody . but i do n't get a chance to hit anyone at least when i decide to . instead , all i can see are faces . that 's the last thing i wanted to see on my watch . i was just about to turn around and leave when a young boy in his early twenties appears . he takes off running and then stops to talk to someone who says " hey , come here for a moment ! "

too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters . i had never heard of such an idea . it was a stupid movie in the first place . it does nothing for me . i think you can see why i loved it so much as it did its job . however , i also like the characters and the dialogue and the overall feel of things . unfortunately , most of the acting involved is uninteresting and the plot is pretty lame . i felt that we should be able to work with these two .

i had the chance to watch blind spot in barcelona and i enjoyed it tremendously . i thought it to be one of the most beautiful operas in the history of film , although not because i knew what it meant . there were so many different characters on the stage that i did not pay much attention to the plot . i do n't know why people choose to make such a terrible movie but it never failed to get me curious about how they came up with the script . i was sitting in my favorite chair when someone made their way towards me .

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war. The rain, the mud, the explosions - all these things are present but Chaplin seems strangely oblivious to them all. He's in France for one thing: to fight the Germans, something he does with unbelievable success.It almost seems like an extended ego trip for Chaplin - a very funny one, at that - until the final minute when it rises to a new level of poignancy and everything makes sense.Perhaps it's what all soldiers dream of before the go to war.

i saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it . since then i ' ve searched for any evidence of its existence , which is basically the same thing . there was a film about a man who lived in an apartment with a girlfriend and her family ; he went to work every day and worked every night until one night when he could no longer keep up with his workload . at that time , we thought he was cheating on his wife with her boss , so we sent him to the bank and he got some money for his job and then left .

Well, I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning. This movie wasn't it. It plodded along at a pretty slow, deliberate pace for the first 40 minutes, but there wasn't really anything in it that I was terribly interested in--there's an intriguing and mysterious feud between Jean Reno's character and an old man, but more of the first 40 minutes is dominated by the wanderings of the main character, whom I didn't know much about and couldn't really relate to at the time.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans. Okay I'm sure it's not as good as what the Child's Play movie were like, but this can get really funny and enjoyable, Chucky's laughs are hilarious. (SPOILERS)Now not one doll, but two, meaning double the impact, Jennifer Tilly played the part really well and definitely pulled off the best kill of the movie.If you have seen the Child's Play movies this would be a worthy film on your Chucky collection, but if you've never seen the Child's play movies before, this'll will be a new start.

like a few people i know , i came in late on ' stingers ' ; not until 2000 . three or four years after that i decided to stop using all the old movies . there were lots of great ones and there was one big one that hit the spot . this one was good because it brought back some of the greatest horror movies i 've ever seen . i liked the whole scene , but if you watch it for too long it starts to get kind of creepy . it does n't matter though , the ending is just another piece of shit .

` ` do n ' t torture a duckling ' ' is one of the coolest italian horror films i ' ve ever seen , and you don ' t have to tell me how . in my opinion , when you watch it , it is so funny that you feel sorry for the characters . even worse , it is not as bad as we thought it should be . it seems to be just like anything else about this movie . i think i won ' t even begin to explain the fact that it was made by the very same man who stole the life of two people whose lives may have been lost .

this is probably the second best of the death wish movies . death wish 5 is the best one . death wish # 2 is actually a plot for the movie , but that 's okay . in fact it was just the most depressing zombie horror film ever made . i think the worst thing i can do is make it to this part of the film and not get hurt by the characters . i feel like i am walking through hell . you know , there are plenty of good guys here but they all have the same ending .
